\nFor live acts, Jaipur\u2019s as good a.description: When Delhi-based Hindi rock band Agastya performed in Jaipur, the band members were of the opinion that in organising such live acts, Jaipur matches up quite well to the capital. Belting out one hit after the other, the band performed in front of the crowd at Indralok Auditorium on Friday . The event was part of the series of cultural events organised to commemorate the eighth anniversary celebration of the Times Of India, Jaipur.  Joshua Moses, the lead vocalist of the band, said he received a very warm welcome in the city. “Itna warm welcome tha ki do baar nahaana pad gaya,” he joked, adding, “I’ve performed in Jaipur a lot of times and I love the audience here.” The band played songs like Kabira, Aaj Kal Tere Mere Pyar Ke Charche, Ek Tara, Damadam Mast Kalandar, Kinna Sohna Tenu, Saawan Mein Lag Gayi Aag, among others.  Jaipur may not be the ideal city for upcoming rock bands to set base, but Joshua is of the opinion that the situation isn’t that bad either. “I have seen a lot of rock bands that have mushroomed in the last couple of years in Jaipur. A few of them have even collaborated with us on some projects. I think Jaipur is no less than Delhi, but it’s necessary to organise rock gigs on a regular basis here and also having popular rock bands from Delhi and Mumbai perform here. This will help create a hype about rock music.”  Diksha Tickoo, who was present at the gig, said, “They put up a good show and I totally enjoyed it.” Another guest Bhumika Juneja, added, “I always look forward to new gigs. I think they did a wonderful job and we enjoyed the evening to the fullest.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Doctors strike.description: KOLKATA: Junior doctors in Bengal finally called off their week-long strike and promised to resume duty on Tuesday morning, ending a stir that crippled out patient departments (OPDs) and severely hit emergency services at hospitals across the state. At a meeting held at state secretariat Nabanna on Monday evening, West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee told a team of 31 junior doctors, " Lakkhi chhele, ebar tomra strike tule nao (Please withdraw your strike like good boys)", which they agreed to. The "cordial" negotiations between the CM and doctors were broadcast live for about 100 minutes by two regional channels. The doctors, who had adopted a strident posture against the administration for the initial police inaction against the kin of a bereaved patient at NRS Hospital last Monday (incident that triggered the stir) relented in the face of genuine-sounding assurances from the CM. The state administration medical fraternity face-off escalated after Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee issued a stern warning of action against the strike during her visit to SSKM Hospital last Thursday. What could have also played on their minds was the rising public opinion against the continuing strike, especially after the CM's appeal for talks last weekend. The striking doctors returned to the NRS campus on Monday and, after another general-body meeting, made a statement: "We hereby announce the withdrawal of the strike by junior doctors." Several issues were discussed at the meeting. They ranged from security measures - collapsible gates for emergency wards, regulated entry for patients' kin and enhanced police presence on medical campuses with nodal officers responsible for law and order - to the CM's suggestion for third-party PR professionals, who could act as grief counsellors and handle communication between "overworked doctors" and "aggrieved patients' kin" and grievance cells for patients. "We are delighted with the cordial manner in which the meeting was held, the CM's caring touch and concrete suggestions and assurances to the issues raised by us," one of the junior doctors said. "They (doctors) have genuine demands. We have listened to them and taken decisions to resolve them. This must be a continuous process. We have to see to it that such untoward incidents are averted and action is taken if something happens," Mamata said. The CM's "gentleness", however, came with the message that she could not be bullied. Urged by the junior doctors to visit the doctor who was injured in the NRS attack, and come to the NRS campus, she said, "Leave certain things to us...Give me your word that you will resume duty." Many courses in Rajasthan University fai.description: JAIPUR: There seem to be only few takers for certain certificate courses at Rajasthan University (RU) for which less than 10 admission forms have been received. Faculty crunch, no infrastructure and lack of awareness about the courses have been some of the prominent reasons that students are not applying. H R Khan, head of the department of Urdu and Persian at RU, talks about the problems that his department is facing. “We have six teachers in our department but two faculty will retire within two months. We are in urgent need of 18 teachers. Students will take interest if there is good faculty. In certificate courses, we are barely managing to fill 20 seats in Urdu and Persian due to lack of faculty. We had to stop MPhil, honours and certificate diploma courses due to shortage of faculty. The future of both these courses is very bleak in our university,” said Khan. RU provides bachelor’s degree in courses like painting, applied art and sculpture for four years. These courses come under visual arts department. Although there is no required 10+2 stream or entrance test for these courses, still they face the challenge of filling seats. Professor T J Kavoor, assistant professor in-charge of the sculpture department in RU says that 70% of their course is practical and 30% theoretical. “We do not have any teacher for theoretical subjects. In the department of visual arts, we need at least 16 teachers but have only four. We have asked the RU administration many times last year when the recruitment process was going on for more faculty but they do not take our subjects very seriously. Our teachers went to meet the governor as well. When our students apply in other universities for higher education, they are rejected in interviews due to lack of theoretical knowledge. What is the use of opening these courses when administration cannot maintain them,” said Kavoor. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Yogi Adityanath.description: VARANASI: Uttar Pradesh chief minister Yogi Adityanath slammed Congress president Rahul Gandhi for suddenly showing concern for the poor and asked why he didn’t ensure a minimum income scheme for them during Congress-led UPA regime when his mother Sonia Gandhi acted as ‘super prime minister’ and had a say in everything. Targeting Congress announcement of minimum income scheme for poor on coming to power, Yogi said, “Congress led UPA was in power in Centre from 2004 to 2014. Everybody knows how Rahul and his mother (Sonia Gandhi) were influential in UPA regime. However, in UPA’s 10-year regime Congress never showed the kind of sympathy for poor, unemployed, farmers and women of country like it is showing now for Pakistan.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Shiv Sena List 2019.description: MUMBAI: Shiv Sena has come up with it's first list of 21 candidates, out of 23 to contest in Lok Sabha polls in Maharashtra. Except Osmanabad, 17 sitting Sena MP's are part of the list, includes Mumbai, Thane, Kalyan, Raigad. Following complaints received by local functionaries from Osmanabad, the party has denied ticket to sitting MP Ravindra Gaikwad. Gaikwad, who had allegedly hit an Air India staffer with his slipper because he was refused a business class seat in March 2017. Maharashtra: Track here Lok Sabha elections' full coverageSena has kept two seats, Palghar and Satara, on hold, likely to announce on Sunday. Late Chintaman Wanga, former BJP MP's son Shrinivas likely to contest from Palghar on Sena ticket whereas former NCP legislator Narendra Patil may might contest as Sena candidate from Satara. Patil met Shiv Sena president Uddhav Thackeray on Friday at Matoshree. Other candidates are: South Mumbai: Arvind Sawant; South Central Mumbai: Rahul Shewale; Mumbai North West: Gajanan Kirtikar; Kalyan: Shrikant Shinde; Raigad: union minister Anant Gite; Osmanabad: Omraje Nimbalkar, Ratnagiri-Sindhudurg: Vinayak Raut; Kolhapur-Sanjay Mandlik; Hatkanangle: Dhairyasheel Mane; Nashik: Hemant Godse; Shirdi: Sadashiv Lokhande; Shirur: Shivajirao Adhalrao Patil; Aurangabad: Chandrakant Khaire; Yavatmal Washim: Bhawana Gawli; Buldana: Prataprao Jadhav; Ramtek: Kripal Tumane; Amrawati-Anandrao Adsul, Parbhani: Sanjay Jadhav; Maval: Shrirang Barne; Hingoli: Hemant Patil. \u2018Will oppose delimitation of pancha.description: JAIPUR: State BJP will continue to oppose the delimitation of panchayats by the state government. The decision came during a state level working committee meet held in Jaipur on Sunday. “Congress government has taken a decision of delimiting panchayats which will be opposed tooth and nail. They have taken the decision on their own without following the rules,” said Madan Lal Saini, state president of BJP. Sharpening his attack, Saini said that government’s priorities are not in sync with people and they have lost confidence of the people. “Government has no control over crime in the state. The number of rape cases are on an all-time high, the sand mafia has no fear of the law. They are attacking police and people while the government is busy solving party’s internal fight,” said Saini. Taking a dig at the changes made in the revised textbooks, Saini said that Congress party has axed the role models of BJP which is condemnable. “It is very unfortunate that government is acting with vengeance. They are not adopting the polices and schemes made by the central government. They have closed down Bhamashah Yojana, not implementing Ayushman Bharat Yojana, contractors are not getting their dues, employees their salaries and people are waiting for electricity. They have failed to show any governance in the state,” said Saini. Former CM Vasundhara Raje said that people of the state have given their mandate to the BJP in the Lok Sabha polls. “People are so angry with the government within five months of their rule that they gave BJP a lead in 185 state assembly segments out of 200 in the Lok Sabha polls. Congress has not taken a lead even in the assembly segments won by CM Ashok Gehlot and deputy CM Sachin Pilot. It shows that they have lost their mandate,” said Raje. The meeting was attended by all newly elected MPs. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Jaipur discom officials held for bribe.description: KOTA: Anti-Corruption Bureau (ACB) on Monday arrested a junior engineer (JEN) and a lineman, posted in assistant engineer’s (AEN) office of Jaipur discom in Ratlai town of Jhalawar district. The duo had demanded bribe of Rs 5,000 from a local farmer for changing his transformer in his agriculture land in Chokadi village. The role of assistant engineer who was caught by ACB in an inebriated state is also suspected. The accused junior engineer is a native of Darbhanga district in Bihar and had obtained job at the Discom as JEN in October 2018. The lineman has been identified as Arif Mohammad, said ASP, ACB, Jhalawar, Bhawani Shankar Meena. Parmanand Lodha, a farmer of Chokadi village in Ratlai area on June 10 had approached ACB Jhalawar and lodged a complaint that the two officials had demanded a bribe of Rs 5,000 for changing transformer in his agricultural land. The farmer first met the JEN with an application to change the transformer but the JEN asked him to meet the lineman, who, on behalf of JEN Nishant Divyanshu, asked for a bribe amount of Rs 7,000 for the work. The amount was later settled at Rs 5,000. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

PM Modi.description: JEYPORE: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday said his government had taken measures to set up a 'chowkidar' in space and asked people to vote for a government that can take concrete decisions and not just raise slogans. Launching his campaign in eastern India with a rally in Jeypore area of Odisha's Koraput district, the prime minister said the NDA government wouldn't have been able to do any development work in the country without the support of the people. He sought blessings from his supporters for the 2019 Lok Sabha elections and asserted that the NDA government has left no stone unturned to bring about development in the state. Land, air or space, we had courage to do surgical strikes: PM Modi"The NDA government has been working hard to develop road and rail infrastructure in the state. There is no dearth of funds when it comes to development work in the country. "In the last five years, the government has been able to build homes for eight lakh families, light up 3,000 houses and provide gas connections to 40 lakh homes," Modi stated. Referring to Mission Shakti, when India demonstrated anti-satellite (ASAT) missile capability by shooting down a live satellite, he said the government has taken measures to set up a 'chowkidar' (watchman) in space. He came down heavily on opposition parties who he said "belittled" the space achievement. "Those that are criticising the anti-satellite technology will be given a befitting reply in the elections," he claimed, urging people to vote for a government that can take concrete decisions, not the one that only raises slogans. In Video:Govt has taken measures to set up 'chowkidar' in space: PM Narendra Modi in OdishaDownload The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Urmila Matondkar.description: MUMBAI: The Congress on Friday nominated actress Urmila Matondkar and former Lok Sabha speaker Meira Kumar from Mumbai North and Bihar's Sasaram parliamentary constituencies respectively. The party renominated its sitting MP Ranjet Ranjan from Supaul in Bihar, as it released a list of another 12 candidates for the general elections. With this list, the Congress has so far nominated 305 Lok Sabha candidates. Urmila Matondkar to contest from Mumbai North parliamentary constituency on a Congress ticket.… https://t.co/JweKWNh1FN— ANI (@ANI) 1553836382000It also changed its candidate in Uttar Pradesh's Maharajganj by now fielding Supriya Shrinate in place of Tanushree Tripathi, the daughter of jailed politician Amarmani Tripathi, after facing widespread criticism. "The Congress central election committee has approved the candidature of Urmila Matondkar as party candidate to contest the ensuing general elections from Mumbai North parliamentary constituency in Maharashtra," a party statement said. Matondkar had joined the Congress after meeting Rahul Gandhi on Wednesday and had later said that she was "here to stay". Meira Kumar have been contesting from her Sasaram parliamentary constituency for many years but had lost in the 2014 Lok Sabha polls. Apart from Supriya Shrinate, in the list of 12 candidates released by the party, four are from Bihar and seven from Odisha. The Congress also released a list of 20 candidates for Odisha Assembly election. 291 more rly stations to get free Wi-Fi.description: JAIPUR: After providing Wi-Fi facility in 67 stations, north western railways (NWR) is now aiming at extending this facility to almost every station excluding the ones which do not have station masters. In this series, the authorities are planning to extend this facility to 291 more stations by September 31. This will include smaller stations like the D and E class remote stations. On May 14, 2016, Jaipur railway station got the facility and since its inception the facility is very popular among the rail passengers. While waiting for their trains, the passengers are into watching, downloading videos. On Sunday, many passengers enjoyed seamless telecast of the much-awaited India versus Pakistan match prior to catching their train to various destinations. Authorities said that the railways is planning to extend the facility to even smaller stations and aims at extending it to every station. “Only the halt stations which do not have station masters would be spared. We are aiming at extending the facility to 291 more stations,” said Abhay Sharma, chief public relations officer, NWR told TOI. Presently 14 stations of Ajmer division, 22 of Bikaner division, 14 of Jaipur division and 17 of Jodhpur division of north western railways have the Wi-Fi facility. “We have not only started this facility in A1, A and B class stations but we have also included the D and E class stations like Nasirabad (Ajmer), Mahajan (Bikaner), Asalpur Jobner (Jaipur) and Pokaran (Jaisalmer),” said an officer with the NWR. The speed of internet is around 25Mbps for the first half-an-hour for the passenger and thereafter only the speed is reduced without any charges. “A passenger just needs to activate Wi-Fi on his phone and register through his mobile phone number to get the OTP-. After submitting the OTP he or she can enjoy seamless internet to download games, movies, songs and even watch live TV. Since its inception this has been a very popular feature on the railway stations,” the officer added. A passenger can avail free facility for half-an-hour with 25Mbps speed once in 24 hours. Many people frequently visit railway station to download larger files and even to download software uploads. “It is faster compared to any other network. Many a times when I need to update various files I visit railway station just by paying for a platform ticket to get hi-speed internet,” said Shubham Sharma who was visiting New Delhi by Shatabadi on Monday. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Satta Market.description: BHOPAL: This assembly  is turning out to be a nail-biter. The Bhopal satta bazaar that gave BJP a good chance three weeks ago is suddenly abuzz about Congress’ prospects. As per the bookies, till about a month ago, if a person placed a bet of Rs 10,000 on BJP, he would get Rs 11,000 if the party returned to power. And anyone who bet Rs 4,400 on Congress would get Rs 10,000 if the opposition wins. This week, bookies say, they are taking bets on number of seats and not on who would form the government. “In case no party gets absolute majority, or if the scoreline is too close,” explained a bookie. “We do not want to say which party will form the government. The bets are open. The satta market is running good this poll season, as it is a thrilling contest,” he added. Bookies told TOI that satta trends may not reflect the actual situation on the ground, but the market is accepting bets on 116-plus seats for Congress and 102 or more for ruling BJP. “Anyone who bets successfully on BJP or Congress will double his money,” a bookie said, adding that this trend may change just as suddenly in the next few days as campaigning gets more intense. The same bookie had told TOI around a month ago that rates may vary once candidates are finalised by the parties, “but we expect the trend to remain the same”. The satta market runs into crores in every election. Bets are placed not just over phone, but also on websites and apps, leaving almost no room for police to track down bookies and those placing bets. Probably, this is why no gang has been busted in the state so far for running an election betting racket. At least two cases of betting are registered daily in Bhopal, but the people pulling the strings of the racket in poll season are yet to be caught. Police officers say it is getting increasingly difficult to nab such gangs because they are constantly on the move. “Online betting can be operated even from a moving car, a café or any public place anywhere in the country. Those running the betting in Bhopal may be sitting anywhere on the globe,” said an officer. SP-south Rahul Kumar Lodha said a special campaign is being run against criminals involved in gambling and betting ahead of elections. “These criminals are made to sign bonds to prevent them from committing such crimes in the future. Raids are being conducted on specific tips. A list of habitual offenders is being prepared by police stations to curb such illegal activities,” he said. ASP-crime Rashmi Mishra said the crime branch has activated its network of informers prior to elections to keep an eye on betting. “It is difficult to crack online betting and gambling rackets, but police take action against criminals on specific inputs. For instance, we were tipped off on Monday night about a betting den in Kolar. It was raided but no such activity was found,” Mishra said, adding that the cyber cell is constantly on the lookout for websites and mobile apps used by betting rackets. Sadhvi Pragya.description: NEW DELHI: BJP MP from Bhopal Sadhvi Pragya Singh Thakur created a controversy on the first day of 17th Lok Sabha on Monday when she suffixed the name of her spiritual guru with hers while taking oath, drawing objections from the opposition. Amid protests and shoutings, Thakur said that it was her full name and she had already mentioned it in the form she had filled for oath taking. The mention of Swami Purna Chetnanand Avdheshanand Giri as suffix to her name evoked sharp reaction from the opposition members who said that such a thing was not permitted. She insisted that the suffix was part of her full name, resulting in an uproar from opposition and slogan shouting in her favour from the ruling benches. Following the din, Pro-tem Speaker Virendra Kumar asked the Lok Sabha secretary general about Pragya's full name. Amid noise and objections, Kumar ruled that only the name written in her election certificate issued by the returning officer would go on record. Thakur, the Malegaon blast accused, took oath in Sanskrit and ended it with 'Bharat Mata Ki Jai' slogan. Thakur defeated Congress stalwart Digvijay Singh to enter the Lok Sabha for the first time. Later, BJP members continued to raise 'Bharat Mata Ki Jai' slogans, teasing the opposition. They started raising slogan after oath taking by every BJP member. After Ganjendra Umarao Singh Patel (BJP) completed his oath with 'Bharat Mata Ki Jai', N K Premchandran (RSP) urged the Pro tem Speaker to maintain the prescribed format of the oath. The Pro tem speaker ruled that the members stick to the format provided. After this, the members of BJP started adding 'Bharat Mata Ki Jai' after end of every oath. Some of the prominent names who took oath from Madhya Pradesh included K P Yadav who defeated Jyotiraditya Scindia, Rakesh Singh, Ramakant Bhargava and Nakul Nath. Indore MP Shankar Lalwani took oath in Sindhi. In Video:Lok Sabha: Sadhvi Pragya made to take oath againDownload The Times of India News App for Latest India News.

Rajasthan: Here, the cemetery gives you.description: JAIPUR: Once a bustling community at Abu Road, today the word ‘Jew’ fails to ring a bell amongst the local populace. So, the only way to find the Jewish cemetery in the city is to ask for the Christian graveyard. “No one from the community exists anymore. Once the population of Jews was around 150-200. But most of them migrated to Israel or other parts of India seeking better opportunities,” says Ratan Bennett holding onto the rusted gate of the Jewish cemetery with a ‘Star of David’ on it. Ratan Bennett (70) is the only person in the city with a Jewish heritage. Born as Abbey Gail Jared in Abu city, she was a Jew before converting to Christianity after her marriage. With only eight graves, the Jewish cemetery has no boundary wall. The land surrounding the cemetery is full of wild plants and thorny bushes. The epitaphs are in Hebrew and English and only state the name and date of death of the person. The oldest grave dates back to 1904. “Abu Road was one of the biggest railway junctions in the British era. Jews, have always been an educated community who settled here to work in the railways. Earlier, the boundaries of this cemetery were intact. Some graves used to have beautiful statues of a woman reading from the Torah (Jewish religious scripture) but slowly due to encroachment and neglect it is now in a dilapidated condition. Around 40 years back, my uncle was the last Jew in the city who migrated to Israel,” recalled Ratan. Ratan’s maternal grandfather who was a guard in railways is buried at the Abu Road cemetery and her paternal grandfather is buried at another Jewish cemetery in Ajmer. These are the only two places to have Jewish cemeteries in Rajasthan. Like on Abu Road, Jews settled in Ajmer were also in the railways. Once a flourishing community, now there are no more Jews left in Rajasthan. As per the 2001 census, one Jew was recorded to be living but no one knows his whereabouts. Migration towards Israel started after its formation in 1948. As per Hansey Timoty (42), a Christian, who is the fourth generation of his family taking care of the Jewish cemetery in Ajmer, the last person buried there was in 1962. “This is the grave of a six-year-old girl who died in an accident. Her father was in railways before migrating to Israel in 1965. Since then, some of her relatives and others have come to pay a visit once in a while. Otherwise, even the municipal authorities of Ajmer have no clue about this place,” said Hansey. Like Abu Road, Ajmer Jewish cemetery is bordering with the CNI Church Christian Graveyard at Christian Ganj. Built around the same time as Abu Road cemetery, the Ajmer Jewish cemetery has 46 graves and is in shambles with no one to look after it. At its peak, Jews were 250–300 in number before migrating to Israel. At present, both the cemeteries are looked after by the Jewish community settled in Ahmedabad. Joint secretary of the Magen Abraham Synagogue (Jewish place of worship) Jacob Robin Srigawkar while talking to TOI expressed concern about the fate of two cemeteries. \nMarriage, pakode and Jaipur on funnyma.description: Necessity may well be the mother of all inventions, but for comedian Maheep Singh, what could possibly have been the necessity to create pakode is hard to fathom. In Jaipur last Saturday to perform at the Birla Auditorium, he asked the audience, “Who would have thought ki sabzi ko besan mein daal kar, usko fry kiya jayega? It is boredom which is the mother of all inventions, not necessity.” He added, “And marriage is another example of boredom.” These were only a few of the quips directed at the audience by the stand-up comedian during his gig.  From creation of language, evolution of mankind, Valentine’s Day and how he ruined his father’s publishing business to him dealing with depression – Maheep’s session had an amusing take on all of these. “We created the definition of success and failure and now we’ve restricted ourselves in our head. It’s important to embrace failure or you will never learn. Failure is inevitable. After experiencing one failure after the other, I turned into a really angry person who felt depressed and dejected. In that state, I could have easily shot anybody who tried to mess with my head. The choice was clear – to give in to the anger or make people laugh using comedy. I chose the latter,” he said as he addressed a young audience.  Those expecting Rajasthani jokes didn’t get to hear any because Maheep didn’t know any. “I only crack jokes about sardaars because it’s good to laugh at yourself,” he told us, adding, “I enjoy Marwari jokes, but unfortunately I don’t know any. Now I will learn some so that whenever I am in Jaipur next, I can crack some Marwari jokes or those directed at the people of Jaipur,” he added. Talking about what makes for a good stand-up comedian, he said, “A good stand-up comedian acts as a vent for people to channel their everyday frustration. So if you cuss at a politician, people enjoy it because deep down they’re also tired of their country’s political system. Woh gaali dena chahate hain, aur ek stand-up comedian unki feelings ko voice karta hai.”  Having performed in Jaipur many times, Maheep is glad that the city now witnesses several comedy gigs. He said, “Jaipur is a city that never fails to impress me. People of Jaipur are very receptive and I am happy to know that comedy gigs are happening so frequently in this city.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

DRDO study on increasing working capacit.description: JAISALMER: The Defence Research & Development Organisation (DRDO) has started a study to increase the working capacity of BSF jawans living in adverse conditions in the country and to keep them disease-free. DRDO’s Defence Institute of Physiology and Allied Science (DIPAS) section (Timarpur, Delhi) is studying around 50 jawans. In the last 10 days data has been collected and work will soon begin. Sources said that DRDO scientists have been studying jawans for last 10 days in the morning and at the peak time when temperature crosses 50 degrees. Blood sugar, heartbeat, pulse rate etc of these jawans are being noted. Sources added that deployment of jawans in areas with excessive heat and their activities are being tested in a scientific manner under this module. A scientist of DRDO who reached Jaisalmer said that a special module has been introduced by DIPAS group of DRDO. The module will try and find out how to reduce body temperature, mental stress, make the digestive system better and keep the BP and heart rate normal. Activities where jawans do not feel thirsty frequently or do not face the problem of heatstroke will also be conducted. Source said that government will act on the recommendation of this study. BSF Rajasthan Frontier IG Anil Paliwal has confirmed that DRDO is doing a study on BSF jawans. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Jaipur: Khandelwal, Poonia served show-c.description: JAIPUR: Congress candidate from the Jaipur parliamentary seat Jyoti Khandelwal and Pradesh Congress Committee secretary Dhoop Singh Poonia were served show-cause notices by the All India Congress Committee (AICC) for publically airing their grievances against the party leaders. The party has sought an explanation from both the leaders who were asked to reply in seven days. Since the Lok Sabha debacle various Congress leaders, MLAs and others were into mudslinging against each other and were showing their annoyance of defeat on public platform. Both the leaders received the notice through registered post on Sunday. Jyoti Khandelwal had alleged that media chairperson of Congress party in Rajasthan, Archana Sharma and her husband Somendra Sharma conspired to defeat her in the Lok Sabha elections. Poonia on the other hand had posted on the social networking platforms and alleged that PCC president and deputy CM Sachin Pilot has no time for party workers. Cognizance was taken by the party high command on the action of these leaders in a scenario where AICC general secretary and in-charge Avinash Pandey had specifically told Congressmen in Rajasthan not to air their public opinion on the disastrous defeat of the party. When contacted, Poonia confirming the notice, said, “Many others had raised questions after party’s defeat but why is the serving of notices so selective. In my reply I am going to give reference of other statements. What I said was constructive criticism.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Jodhpur district court acquits Salman in.description: JODHPUR: In a major relief to Salman Khan, the Jodhpur chief judicial magistrate (CJM)’s court acquitted the actor in a case of submitting false affidavits on Monday and rejected charges made by the prosecution. Khan had moved an affidavit in the court in 2006 in relation to a case against him under the Arms Act, stating that he had lost his arms licence. The prosecution had alleged that he had submitted a false affidavit, claiming that he had not lost his licence but submitted it for renewal. Khan’s counsel H M Saraswat argued that since the actor had already been acquitted in the case, there was no point in continuing with the matter.“We also argued that the affidavit was not intentional as he was busy and didn’t have an exact idea about his licence then,” Saraswat said. Jodhpur: While seeking exemption from appearance in the court during trial, Khan had stated in a second affidavit that he could not appear on a certain day due to ear pain and was advised against air travel. Claiming the affidavit as false, the prosecution argued that Khan was busy shooting for the movie, ‘Bajrangi Bhaijaan’, in Jammu & Kashmir and had misled the court. “We clarified to the court that Khan was shooting then and was advised not to travel by air,” Saraswat said. CJM Ankit Raman rejected both the applications by the prosecution, providing a major relief for Khan, who has been facing four cases in various courts. “Had these applications by the prosecution been admitted by the court, Khan could have been subject to seven years’ imprisonment for submitting false affidavits,” said Mahipal Bishnoi, one of the prosecution counsels. Khan had been acquitted in two cases of poaching by the high court and appeals by the state government are pending before the Supreme Court. In a third case of poaching, he has been convicted by the trial court and the appeal is pending in the sessions court. Similarly, the state government’s challenge against Khan is pending before the sessions court after the trial court had acquitted him in the case under the Arms Act. \nThe Goodenoughs\u2019 Indian cricket o.description: On Monday evening, the entire family – including Gene’s parents John and Geri, Preity’s mother Neel Prabha, brother Deepankar Zinta, watched Kings XI Punjab taking on Virat Kohli’s Royal Challengers Bangalore in Mohali. The couple wore the team’s official red jersey, while the other family members chose a simple KXIP T-shirt. According to a source at the stadium, Preity was stressed throughout the match and so, Gene kept interacting with her in between to help ease the tension. They were also spotted holding hands. The actress kept doing rounds of the stadium as she cheered her team on. Number game and an extra G The jerseys the couple wore for the match were quite similar. Both had 111 embossed along with the initials of their names. If Preity’s jersey had 111 PZ written on its back, Gene’s jersey had an extra G added, making it 111 GGG. A source told us that the additional G is the initial of a family member Gene is very attached to. Weeding rituals in Himachal The couple had driven back from Preity’s hometown in Himachal the same morning. “They took the road to Chandigarh from Preity’s hometown. Since it involved driving around in the hills and the distance was a lot, they were all tired. Despite starting early on Monday morning, the entire family reached Chandigarh in the afternoon,” a source said, adding that all of them were to fly to Mumbai yesterday to take stock of the preparations for the reception on May 13.  We hear that Gene and Preity’s families stayed in her native village for three days. Besides roaming around, they also completed the wedding rituals, which took place in typical Himachali style. They also met some of their close relatives and friends who stay there. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Anantnag Encounter.description: SRINAGAR: An Army Major died while another officer of the same rank and two soldiers were injured in a gunfight at Bidoora village, in Achabal area of south Kashmir's Anantnag district, on Monday, a defence spokesman said. A Pakistani terrorist was killed in the encounter. Major Ketan Sharma of 19 Rashtriya Rifles, who died in the Achabal encounter, belonged to Meerut. A police officer said they had found the body of a Pakistani terrorist and seized arms and ammunition from the encounter site. The identity of the slain terrorist was being ascertained. In another attack, at least nine Army soldiers were injured in an IED blast that targeted a security vehicle of 44 RR at Aarihal village in Pulwama on Monday evening. Those injured in the Achabal gunfight and IED blast were rushed to the Army's 92 Base hospital in Srinagar, officials said. In the third attack in 24 hours, terrorists lobbed a grenade at the headquarters of the 180 CRPF battalion camp in Tral sub-district of Pulwama late on Monday evening. The grenade exploded outside the headquarters. No casualties have been reported. The first attack happened on Monday morning when a team of security men was on a cordon-and-search operation in Achabal. Terrorists fired at the team, who then retaliated. In the Pulwama attack, the terrorists after setting off the IED, opened fire at the Army vehicle. "Initial reports reveal the vehicle suffered extensive damage," the official said. Three of the soldiers injured in the blast were said to be serious, sources said. Soon after the attack, Army, police and SOG reinforcements were rushed to the spot and a massive search operation was launched. A defence spokesman, however, said some of the men sustained minor injuries in the IED blast. Damage was minimal due to the alertness of the patrol party, he said. The vehicle was an armoured ALS and not a Casspir (a mine-resistant, ambush-protected vehicle), he added. In Video:Indian Army’s vehicle attacked by IED in J&K’s PulwamaDownload The Times of India News App for Latest India News.

PMAY sets target of 3.64 Lakh homes for.description: JAIPUR: Even as in the last financial year (2018-19) the state missed several deadlines to complete the construction of sanctioned number of houses under Pradhan Mantri Awaas Yojana – Grameen (PMAY-G), the rural development department has set a target of 3.64 lakh houses in the state for 2019-20. The department already has a balance amount of Rs 45.57 crore under PMAY scheme. According to a rural development department order, 74,163 houses have been allotted to scheduled castes, 1.45 lakh houses allotted to scheduled tribes, 16,792 to the minorities and 1.27 lakh houses to others. The estimated target which was earlier set at 3.66 lakh was later reduced to 3.64 lakh houses in a revised order dated June 13. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

JDA aims to develop 35 greewood parks to.description: JAIPUR: The Jaipur Development Authority (JDA) will develop 35 greenwood parks in the city. The aim of this scheme is to plant trees instead of grass and flowers to save water. The scheme is about having plantation in the city parks where there are no borewells or the borewells have become dry due to which irrigation facility is not available. In these parks around 5,520 trees will be planted which will be maintained by Jaipur Development Authority for the next two years. Senior horticulturist S P Bhadu of JDA while talking to TOI explained, “This idea was discussed to save as much water as possible because in flowering plants, grass and other gardens hundreds of litres of water is wasted and they need more maintenance. Once the trees are planted they require water only 3-4 times every month. Hence, they will be easily maintained. The entire operations will cost us around Rs 38.92 lakh.” As monsoon is approaching, government will distribute around 21,000 saplings to the residents of the city who would have to take care of the plants later. These plants can be taken from the public parks of the area. Similarly, JDA will even plant saplings in government schools and office premises that will later be maintained by the respective departments. Recently, JDA had put QR code on a few trees in Central Park. Any person can scan the code from his mobile and get information about the tree – species, usage and place of origin. While explaining this scheme Bhadu said, “We have launched it recently and around six trees in the Central Park have this facility. The plan is to gradually spread it to more plants and trees in the Central Park and other public parks of the city.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Tamil Nadu Elections.description: Voting for Lok Sabha elections 2019 in Tamil Nadu will take place in a single phase on April 18 as per the notification issued by the Election Commission of India. The counting of votes will take place on May 23. | Lok Sabha elections 2019: Get all live updatesThe four-cornered contest for the 39 Lok Sabha seats features AIADMK-led National Democratic Alliance (NDA), its chief rival DMK-led Secular Progressive Alliance (SPA), actor Kamal Haasan's Makkal Needhi Maiam and TTV Dhinakaran's Amma Makkal Munnetra Kazhagam (AMMK). Out of the 39 seats in the state, seven Lok Sabha seats are reserved for SC. The constituencies reserved for SC candidates are Thiruvallur, Kancheepuram, Villupuram, Nilgiris, Chidambaram, Nagapattinam and Tenkasi in Tamil Nadu. | Tamil Nadu Lok Sabha elections: Get all live updatesIn the last Lok Sabha polls, AIADMK had a vote share of 44.3 per cent by winning 37 seats. BJP had a vote share of 5.5 per cent by winning just 1 seat, while NDA managed to win two seats with a vote share of 18.5 per cent PMK won one seat and had a vote share of 4.4 per cent. BJP (NDA) had an alliance with PMK. DMK was not able to win on any seat in the last Lok Sabha polls. In Lok Sabha elections 2019, DMK is contesting on 20 seats, while the Congress is fighting elections on 9 seats in Tamil Nadu. In the AIADMK-BJP alliance, the national party will be contesting from five seats in the state while the PMK will be contesting from seven. Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Himmat faction to hold mahapanchayat tod.description: JAIPUR: As the ultimatum given to the state government by Himmat Singh-led faction of Gujjar Aarakshan Sangharsh Samiti got over on Saturday, they would be holding a Mahapanchayat on Monday in Sikandra to discuss about launching a statewide ‘rail and rasta roko’ agitation. However, three out of five persons belonging to the most backward class (MBC), who have been sitting on hunger strike in Sikandra for over 10 days now, fell ill on Sunday and have been admitted to Dausa hospital. “Three persons – Vishnu Kumar Gurjar, Kushal Chand Gurjar and Vijay Pal Gurjar – have been admitted to Dausa hospital after they fell ill while on hunger strike. The doctors had attended to them and later referred them to Dausa. One person, Ranbir Kasana, ended his hunger strike yesterday (Saturday). Now, just one person Balram is on hunger strike,” said Sikrai SDM Haritabh Kumar Aditya, who visited them at the hospital. Himmat Singh also alleged that nodal officer of Gujjar reservation settlement Neeraj K Pawan was misleading the state government and demanded his removal. Meanwhile, Singh said, “We are expecting a huge number of people from all districts. But, since it has been raining for the past two days, the number could be less. The agenda will be the implementation of 5% reservation for Gujjars (in education and jobs) in totality. There will be discussion on the agitation as well." Kirori Singh Bainsla has not been invited for the Mahapanchayat, he added. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Rajasthan government\u2019s move to incr.description: JAIPUR: Reversing the previous BJP order, state education department has reduced winter vacations of government teachers by seven days while increasing their summer vacations by same number of days. However, this move is objected by the Rajasthan Teachers’ Association as they claimed it will not make any difference. Earlier, summer vacations would start from May 19 and continued till July 1 in the government schools across the state. As the BJP came into power at the Centre and Rajasthan, summer vacations were reduced and schools reopened from June 19 onwards. The decision was taken to celebrate, in schools, Yoga Day on June 21 initiated by the BJP government. In order to compensate, seven days were added in the winter vacations making it 14 days. During the time of elections, Congress government declared that they will reinstate the old vacation timetable. Now, the orders have been issued and the schools will reopen on June 24. The government has also reduced seven days from the winter vacations. The decision has been criticised by teachers from all over the state. Teachers said that the Congress government has played politics. President of Rajasthan Teachers and Panchayati Raj Employees Federation, Narayan Singh Sisodia said, “This order is against the promises made by the government. Teachers are being fooled because it is not going to make any difference. As per the old timetable, they can reduce the winter vacations which they did but addition of seven days in the summer vacations doesn’t change anything.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Chanchal Lahiri.description: KOLKATA: After a day-long search for magician Chanchal Lahiri (41),   who disappeared   while performing an underwater escape act in the Hooghly, police on Monday fished out his body from near Howrah. Later in the evening, Lahiri's brother identified his body. An initial police probe established that Lahiri on Sunday had made several mistakes while attempting the stunt popularised by the famous illusionist and stunt performer Harry Houdini almost 100 years ago. Mandrake trying similar stunt earlierMMiC still in shock after magician’s deathLahiri, who was to come out of the water after being thrown in with his hands and feet bound, , but also wore cumbersome clothing and guards that made swimming in the strong current extremely difficult. Magician PC Sarkar, a master of such stunts, said perhaps Lahiri "needed a little more practice". Lahiri's team, too, waited about 15 minutes after he was lowered into the water to raise an alarm. Chanchal Lahiri on the boat moments before he started the stunt on Sunday Lahiri’s hands and legs were tied with ropes and he was chained with six locks. "When he did not surface for a long time, people panicked. Some onlookers said they saw a man struggling, seeking help, in the middle of the river. Police were informed and a team of divers from the disaster management group joined the rescue operation," said DC (Port) Syed Waquar Raza. Cops will probe if he took advantage of some lacunae on part of the administration and probably paid for it with his life. "A case of negligence is likely to be registered," said a source. Lahiri being lowered into the Hooghly river as he performed one of his tricks in KolkataMagician’s body found; peers say he didn’t take proper precaution Sources said Mandrake never mentioned in his permission letter that he was going to jump into the water. "Lahiri stated the stunt was to happen on a boat or vessel. Hence, we allowed him permission," Raza said. The letter added that he wanted to take photographs and perform an extra event around 1.30pm. The final dip made by Chanchal Lahiri"He performed almost an hour earlier. Hence, river traffic police was absent," said a Port division officer. Police said Lahiri drowned around 12.30pm and it is unclear whether he was performing or practising the act. Moments before the stunt on Sunday, Lahiri said, "If you perform a dangerous trick perfectly, you are a magician. If you fail, it is always tragic." Mandrake's body was fished out on Monday"Bound and chained, Mandrake was lowered 30 feet under water. Thousands watched and it is impossible the cops missed the entire episode when even politicians were present," claimed a friend on Monday. In 2013, when Lahiri performed the same stunt, he was assaulted by the crowd of onlookers, who claimed they felt cheated because they had seen through the trick. In Video:Kolkata: Magician drowns in Hooghly while attempting underwater Houdini escape actDownload The Times of India News App for Latest City .

BJP List 2019 WB.description: KOLKATA: The BJP in its first list of 28 candidates for West Bengal has pinned hopes on its veterans and defectors from the ruling Trinamool Congress to take on the Mamata Banerjee's government in the state. Of the 28 candidates, nearly 25 are new faces, with a thrust on active political workers rather than greenhorns from the glamour world. The saffron party, which bagged two Lok Sabha seats in the 2014 elections, is now targeting 23 of the state's 42 constituencies. BJP Lok Sabha first full listUnlike the TMC list, which had 18 new faces and a mix of both old-timers and greenhorns, hardcore politicians and personalities from the film industry, the BJP has put faith on its own leaders and defectors from other parties. There are four women candidates and one Muslim nominee in the first list. Of the candidates, five had recently defected to the saffron party from the Trinamool Congress and one from the CPI(M). West Bengal: Track here Lok Sabha elections' full coverageUnion minister and BJP MP from Asansol Lok Sabha constituency Babul Supriyo has been renominated from the same seat and is pitted against actor Moon Moon Sen of the TMC. State BJP president Dilip Ghosh will contest from Medinipur seat against TMC leader Manas Bhunia. BJP national secretary Rahul Sinha will take on TMC heavyweight Sudip Bandopadhyay in Kolkata North Lok Sabha seat. State BJP vice-president and Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose grandnephew, Chandra Kumar Bose will contest from Kolkata South Lok Sabha seat. Former IPS officer Bharati Ghosh, once known to be close to Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee, will be fighting against TMC candidate and actor Dipak Adhikary, popularly known as 'Dev', from Ghatal Lok Sabha constituency. The BJP has fielded former Trinamool Congress MLA Arjun Singh from Barrackpur Lok Sabha seat. Singh, who had recently joined the saffron party, has been pitted against TMCs Dinesh Trivedi. In Coochbebar Lok Sabha seat, the party has fielded former TMC youth leader Nishith Pramanik, while in Jadavpur Lok Sabha seat, expelled TMC MP Anupam Hazra will contest against TMC's Mimi Chakraborty, an actor by profession. Another former TMC MP Soumitra Khan, who joined the BJP in January, has been given ticket from Bishnupur(SC) Lok Sabha seat. Former CPI(M) MLA Khagen Murmu, who too had switched over to the BJP, will contest from Malda North seat and will take on TMCs Mausam Benazir Noor, who had recently defected to the party from the Congress, in Malda Uttar seat. The Lok Sabha elections in the state will be held from April 11 till May 19 in seven phases. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Cong candidates continue with their blam.description: JAIPUR: Avinash Pande, the Congress general secretary in-charge of Rajasthan began stock-taking of the reasons for failure of the party in the recently held Lok Sabha elections in the state. The BJP won all the 25 seats while chief minister Ashok Gehlot’s son Vaibhav Gehlot failed to open his account from the Jodhpur seat, leaving the party in turmoil. Pande had sent messages to all the party candidates to reach the AICC headquarters in Delhi on Monday as the party is searching for reasons for its abysmal performance despite being in power in the state. There were allegations within the party for as some candidates had alleged that few Congress leaders themselves are responsible for the debacle. It was alleged that these leaders worked against the party candidates and to settle personal scores sabotaged their chances to win. However, the party could not conduct a serious stock-taking after resignation of party’s national president Rahul Gandhi and the leadership crisis facing the party at the national level. The executive committee of the PCC convened after the elections could not hold a free discussion as the meeting dispersed after passing a resolution asking Rahul Gandhi to continue as the party president. Congress candidate from Udaipur seat Raghuveer Meena who could not attend the meeting held in Delhi told TOI, “I had received a message from Pande’s office on Sunday asking me to reach Delhi on Monday. However, I informed of my inability as I am out of the state,” he said. Savita Meena, the party candidate from Dausa claimed that the election fell on Akhshay Tritiya (May 6) which is also the auspicious occasion for marriages. She said many tribal voters could not vote as they were busy with weddings in their community. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Gujjar reservation: Review meeting to be.description: JAIPUR: As the Mahapanchayat of the Himmat Singh-led faction of Gujjar Aarakshan Sangharsh Samiti got over in Sikandra on Monday, they have decided to wait till the government's decision to be taken at the review meeting with the Bainsla-led faction on Tuesday. They have given an ultimatum till June 20 for the government to act on their demand of implementing 5% reservation for Gujjars (in education and jobs) in totality. Meanwhile, an 11-member delegation led by Himmat Singh is set to meet CM Ashok Gehlot at 8 am today to discuss the same. “We have given an ultimatum till June 20 to act on our demands. Tomorrow (Tuesday) there is a meeting of the sub-committee of three ministers. We will keep track of the developments of the meeting. We have not received any invitation for tomorrow’s meeting yet. If they call us, we will go,” said Singh, who had threatened to launch a statewide ‘rail and rasta roko’ agitation. A meeting of the sub-committee of three ministers with the representatives of Gujjar community including Kirori Singh Bainsla, which was earlier scheduled to take place on May 30, would now be held on June 18 (Tuesday). The three ministers who would be present are Raghu Sharma, Bhawarlal Meghwal and Vishvendra Singh. “The committee will be reviewing all the decisions taken with regard to Gujjar reservation. The representatives of the Gujjar community will be present at the meeting. Bainsla has also been invited for the meeting,” said a senior official at social justice and empowerment department. This is first review meeting on Gujjar reservation after the end of Lok Sabha elections in the state. The Mahapanchayat of the Himmat Singh-led faction in Sikandra was attended by around 1,000 representatives of the community from various districts. Meanwhile, the three persons belonging to the most backward class (MBC), who fell ill on Sunday following a hunger strike for over 10 days, were admitted to the Dausa hospital again on Monday after they fled from the hospital this morning to rejoin the protest. “They fled from the hospital without informing the doctors. They are not well and have been admitted again,” said Sikrai SDM Haritabh Kumar Aditya. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Mahagathbandhan.description: NEW DELHI: Taking a swipe at the grand alliance of opposition parties, finance minister Arun Jaitley on Friday said the 'mahagathbandhan' is a 'non-bandhan', political circus and a recipe for chaos. Several political parties, mostly traditional BJP opponents, have come together to take on the National Democratic Alliance (NDA) in the ensuing general elections beginning April 11. In a blog post, Jaitley said that over the last several months, India was "exhausted" with the talk of a 'Mahagathbandhan'. The rationale, he said, was that Prime Minister Narendra Modi and the BJP were very strong and could not be challenged by individual party. Stressing that Indians judge politicians by their merit and capacity and no longer by any traditional loyalty, he said: "We were promised a 'coalition of rivals' because India had to be saved. We were promised a common minimum agenda. Each leader amongst the aspirant Prime Ministers wanted to become a 'sutradhar' (anchor) of the alliance. He/she would periodically organise shows in his/her State and invite the entire bandwagon." In opposition camp, Jaitley said there is a tussle for leadership as already multiple candidates have made their desire clear to take over the mantle of the leadership. According to him, each one of them is interested to see the strength of the other party's contender depleting and also have high hopes in a chaotic and highly hung Parliament. "He/ she believes that only in a chaotic situation he/she has a chance," said Jaitley, who is heading the BJP's publicity division of the seven-phase Lok Sabha elections. The past track record of such governments in terms of policy, longevity and growth has to be borne in mind, he said adding their track record of corruption is equally well-known. Jaitley further said it is only because of the size of the BJP and clarity on leadership in the last coalition that a successful government was run under Prime Minister Modi. "Today you have no 'gathbandhan' let alone 'mahagathbandhan'. It is a 'non-bandhan'. You have no leader, no programme, no meeting of minds. "Stability, which is paramount, is a major casualty. The only thing in common is negative agenda 'remove one man'. It is a recipe for chaos," he said in the blog titled 'A Political Circus Called 'Mahagathbandhan'. The nominations for the first two phases of polling are over and those for the third phase are about to happen. The results will be announced on May 23. Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Showers on Sunday bring down temperature.description: JAIPUR: Many places in the state witnessed mild to moderate showers that guided the mercury to take a dip on Sunday. However, Kota remained hottest where a maximum temperature of 41.1 degree Celsius was recorded. Jaipur Met office stated that similar conditions will prevail in the state on Monday when some places in the eastern and western Rajasthan will receive mild to moderate showers. Showers started at many places since morning on Sunday. There was an average dip of almost 3 degree Celsius. Jaipurites woke up to a comparatively pleasant morning as a minimum temperature of 29.6 degree Celsius was recorded in the city. It was followed by a drizzling noon as scattered rainfall was witnessed in the city. Though many areas in the city got water-logged, people were seen enjoying the pleasant weather. Meanwhile, among many other places in the state that received rainfall was Bhim (Rajsamand) that witnessed a rainfall of 70 mm, which was highest in the state. It was followed by Tibi (Hanumangarh) 30 mm, Chirawa (Jhunjhunu) and Sriganganagar 30 mm. Many other areas in the state also witnessed a rainfall varying between 20 mm and 10 mm. After fortnight-long simmering heat conditions, except Kota, majority of places in the state witnessed maximum temperatures below 40 degree Celsius. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Pushkar fast losing its sheen to ever-gr.description: JAIPUR: Pushkar has been described as ‘a beautiful abode surrounded by hills’ in the ancient scripture of ‘Bhagwat Puran’. However, this holy city is now facing the danger of losing its sheen to expanding sand cover. The climate change alone is not responsible for desertification Pushkar which is located in the midst of serene Aravalli hills. Human intervention is also to be largely blamed for it. The holy city is facing both legal and illegal construction activities for resorts and hotels, sand mafia is eating away the sand dunes and the increasing population is adding to the problems. These factors have diminished the green cover, depleted water sources—underground and reservoirs, cycle of sand dunes is taking the city towards desertification. “The flora and fauna have been severely affected in the last two decades. The land mafia in connivance with the administration has sold the environmentally sensitive land in Budda Pushkar, Motisar, Nand and Sawai Pura around Pushkar to the hospitality sector for building resorts and hotels. This land has always protected the environment of the city which has collapsed,” said Ashok Tak, a social activist based in Pushkar. The activist has also raised concern over the active sand mafia here. Every night several tractors smuggle sand from nearby hills, contributing to the expansion in desert areas. The vast stretches of land on hills and foothills have become barren due to indiscriminate use of groundwater. Reepunjaya Singh, professor of urban planning, Rajasthan Institute of Public Administration (RIPA) said, “It is unfortunate that the holy city has been treated like an upcoming urban city. The administration’s approach has been to sell the place like a hot tourist spot without understanding its topography and sensitivity towards environment. The effects such as increasing sand cover, shortage of water, irreversible loss of biodiversity is just the beginning.” The disappearance of sand dunes has far-reaching effects. Independent studies have established that sand dunes harbour vegetation and fauna and play a role in restricting the expansion of sandy landscape. The independent reports claim that the present situation is compounded results of apathy towards the holy town. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Arvind Kejriwal.description: VISAKHAPATNAM: Delhi chief minister Arvind Kejriwal on Monday said that Congress President Rahul Gandhi has refused to forge an alliance with the AAP for the Lok Sabha polls in the national capital. Full coverage: Lok Sabha electionsTalking to reporters at the airport here, the AAP leader said he had met Gandhi recently and the Congress leader had refused to “join hands with the AAP”. Asked about Congress' Delhi unit president Sheila Dikshit's remarks that Kejriwal never approached her for an alliance, the chief minister said, “We have met Rahul Gandhi. Dikshit is not that important leader.” Kejriwal has been urging the Congress to stitch an alliance in Delhi for the Lok Sabha polls to keep the BJP away from power. Leaders in the Delhi unit of the Congress were divided over the issue of alliance with Dikshit and her three working presidents opposing it, party sources had said. A top source in the party had recently said that chances of alliance were "slim" considering its long term repercussions in Delhi. "The biggest question is how will Congress face the AAP in Assembly elections due in 2020 after the tie up. Also, the party does not gain much politically as it is being offered only 2-3 seats by Kejriwal," the source had said. Congress had drawn a blank in the 2014 parliamentary elections in Delhi. The talk of alliance was fuelled by the fact that the Congress and AAP had jointly polled more votes than the BJP that had walked away with all the seven seats in the national capital. Delhi has 7 Lok Sabha seats and it will go to polls on May 12. In Video:Congress refused to forge alliance with AAP for LS polls: KejriwalDownload The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

AMMK Candidate List 2019.description: CHENNAI: AMMK deputy general secretary TTV Dhinakaran on Friday released the second and final list of candidates - 14 for the Lok Sabha polls and 9 for assembly bypoll in Tamil Nadu. The party has decided to field two of its heavyweight disqualified MLAs to contest Lok Sabha polls and to take on strong candidates from AIADMK alliance. Disqualified MLA from Andipatti and AMMK propaganda secretary, Thanga Tamilselvan, has been fielded from Theni Lok Sabha constituency, he will take on P Ravindranath Kumar, son of deputy chief minister and AIADMK coordinator O Paneerselvam. Disqualified MLA from Paapireddipatti and former minister P Palaniappan will be contesting the Lok Sabha polls from Dharmapuri constituency. He will take on PMK youth wing leader and former Union health minister Anbumani Ramadoss, who is contesting on behalf of the AIADMK-BJP-PMK alliance.| Full coverage of Lok Sabha elections in Tamil NaduBesides these two, AMMK has also selected another disqualified MLA, NG Parthibhan from Sholingar assembly segment, to contest Arakonam Lok Sabha constituency. He will take on former Unions minister of state S Jagathrakshakan of the DMK - Congress alliance on the seat. AMMK had earlier released its first list of 24 candidates for Lok Sabha and 9 candidates for assembly bypoll in the state last Sunday. Dhinakaran will release the party's manifesto for the Lok Sabha polls later during the day. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Photo studio for marriage registration o.description: Jaipur: From now on, people don’t have to carry their photographs with them to the Jaipur Municipal Corporation (JMC) for marriage registration as a photo studio will soon be opening in the building. In the executive committee meeting held on Monday, JMC officials passed the proposal to open a photo studio at the JMC headquarters to click coloured photographs of people for marriage registration. Now, the couples only have to carry their documents and they need not to worry about scanning photographs. JMC additional commissioner Arun Garg while talking to TOI said, “This decision has been taken as most of the times after scanning the quality of photographs gets distorted. Having a photo studio in our premises will solve all the problems of the people who have to visit many times for photo correction. Within a few months this will come into action.” Similar practice has been followed at the Regional Transport Office (RTO) at the time of making a licence. In other decision, JMC executive committee decided to give the community halls in the city free-of-cost for condolence meets. “There are about 12 community halls in the city. We have decided to give them free-of-cost for condolence meetings and will charge nominal fees for garbage and other basic facilities,” said Arun Garg. In the tenure of last mayor, JMC had decided to ban non-vegetarian food items from the community halls in the city which faced criticism throughout the city. This decision was not discussed in the meeting on Monday. Further JMC decided to give contract of collecting garbage from open depots of the city. In total, 25 proposals were put in front of the committee out of which 22 were passed on Monday. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Govt plans peace department.description: JAIPUR: Stressing that the new department of peace and non-violence will spread Mahatma Gandhi's ideas of peace, harmony, tolerance and non-violence to the next generation, chief minister Ashok Gehlot on Monday said, “Initially, it would be established in the form of a cell and gradually be transformed into a department.” He addressed the youth, who had come from different states, on the concluding day of the 10-day National Integration Camp organized to commemorate Gandhi ji’s 150th birth anniversary in Bhanpur Kalan village near Jaipur.  He announced a new policy for silicosis patients. Gehlot met disabled, speech and hearing impaired, minorities and nomads. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Jaipur: Illegal bajri trade gave driver.description: JAIPUR: Right under the nose of the authorities, several tonnes of illegally mined bajri from Sawai Madhopur and Tonk districts enters into the city through major national highways every morning after paying taxes at the toll plazas. The Pratap Nagar police investigating the attack on RTO flying squad by mafia men in Jagatpura on Saturday have revealed that the main accused Giriraj Yadav ensured that his barji-laden trucks arrive in the city from Sawai Madhopur and Tonk without any hassle from cops or the mining department. “It is shocking that Yadav’s truck travelled from Sawai Madhopur to Jaipur, stopped to pay toll and yet nobody checked what was being supplied in his heavy dumper vehicles,” said an official The police said that Yadav is a former truck driver who delivered goods across the state and earned a meagre amount Rs 5,000. His luck changed overnight after he began smuggling sand from Tonk and Sawai Madhopur to Jaipur. “Unlike in his previous stint as a truck driver, the accused claimed he could now earn a direct profit of Rs 35,000 in supplying illegally mined bajri across posh areas of the city like Vaishali Nagar, Malviya Nagar, Mansarover etc,” said an official. Arrested on Saturday late night, the accused said he had struck a rapport with villagers in Datwas in Tonk and Bonli in Sawai Madhopur district. “He used to buy bajri for Rs 15,000 per dumper from villagers. He sold it in the city for a double amount thereby multiplying profits,” said the official. Yadav became so rich in mere six months that he purchased four more dumper trucks to smuggle bajri. “He set up a warehouse in his Kanota located house where bajri was kept for delivery. He also asked his brother-in-law Kalu to join the illegal trade,” the official told TOI. An official informed TOI that Yadav has lived a rags to riches story. “Before bajri ban he was a simple truck driver but as soon as he joined the smuggling business his bank accounts swelled,” said an official. Priyanka Gandhi.description: RAE BARELI: In her scathing attack on BJP and Modi government, Congress general secretary Priyanka Gandhi said that Congress doesn't need any certificate from anyone to prove its nationalist feelings. "Ye brashtachar ki baat karnewale sabse bade brashta hain… kaam ki baat karte hain magar sabse bade nikamme hain… dharma ki baat karne wale sabse bada adharm kar rahe hain - dharm ka istemal kar rahe hain… saheedon ka istemal kar rahe hain - sirf rajinit ke liye (They are talking of acting against corruption but are corrupt themselves… they talk of work but are good for nothing… they talk of dharma (read duties) but indulge in adharma by defying its norms - they use religion and martyrs for political interests)," Priyanka stated in her closed door meeting with cadres on Thursday. The Congress leader hit out at BJP's strategy of playing the nationalist card. "We are Congress… we launched the freedom movement… gave our blood and sweat… braved British atrocities … we don't need any certificate to prove our nationalist feelings especially from the ones who apologised to the British at that time", asserted Priyanka, urging the workers to go to every household in their area and meet every voter. She directed the workers to apprise the voters that the 2019 Lok Sabha election was as important as the freedom movement. Infusing energy in them she said, "Don't be afraid of anything as this is a weak government. Only a weak government curbs the voice of the people, which is a crime in democracy." Priyanka asked the workers to stand up for their leader whose only dream is the progress of India and its people. "Rahul thinks of the people without any vested interest," Priyanka said citing the example of her conversation with Rahul on the issue of using self-help group women for campaigning. "When I proposed to him this idea, he simply denied… saying that I created the SHGs to empower women, not use them in any way," Priyanka said quoting her brother. The Congress general secretary told the workers that she was working on mission 2022. "We will, with your support, form the government in 2022. And once we come, we will stay here for long on the basis of our hard work," she said adding that the hard-workers would be adequately rewarded. Pawan Kalyan.description: GUNTUR: Stating that they will bulldoze bastions of TDP and YSR Congress, Janasena president Pawan Kalyan promised to grant Rs 5,000 pension to all farmers in the state. He said they will also grant Rs 8,000 crop incentive to farmers soon after coming into power in the next elections. Pawan further said his government would provide six to 10 LPG cylinders free-of-cost to each family every year. and also promised to fill 3 lakh vacancies in the government departments to provide jobs to youth. Addressing a meeting in Guntur on Monday, Pawan said that the future of the state did not mean the future of Lokesh and Jagan but it was the future of the people. “The space on the state’s political stage is not TDP’s and YSRC’s property as youth and women are eager to bring change through Jana Sena.” “TDP had lost moral right to rule the state as chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu had no control over his legislators who indulged in illegal activities,” Pawan said adding that he jumped into the political arena to bring in a change in the lives of commoners. “We supported TDP and BJP in the last elections with a hope to transform the state. Unfortunately, both of them have shattered our dreams,” he said. “Guntur city has been left in a lurch despite located a few kilometres away from the capital city. The entire city has been dug out in the guise of laying underground drainage scheme and left without repair. How shocking it is to see 30 people dying of diarrhoea in a city like Guntur? Is it not the failure of the state government? Opposition leader Jaganmohan Reddy is equally responsible for the tragedy as he never dared to question the government by going to the assembly,” he said. He further said they would construct apartments exclusively for Muslims in the city. He appealed to people to support his candidates Chandrasekhar (Guntur West), Zia-Ur-Rehman (East) and MP candidate Bonaboina Srinivas Yadav in the elections, Pawan said they fielded a BC candidate Srinivasa Yadav whereas TDP and YSRC both have given tickets to their own communities. Moderate showers in Raj continue to brin.description: JAIPUR: Mild to moderate showers continued in the state for the fifth consecutive day on Monday and provided relief. Widespread rainfall activity was witnessed at many places in the state and the Jaipur Met office said that similar conditions will prevail in the state in the next couple of days. Kota remained hottest in the state where a maximum temperature of 40.9 degree Celsius was recorded. By and large the weather remained pleasant in the state. People in Churu also witnessed pleasant morning and afternoon after witnessing mercury reaching on and above 50 degree Celsius at least three times in this season so far. Attributing the climatic conditions to the active northerly winds and upper air cyclonic circulation Jaipur Met office said that similar conditions will prevail in the state in the next couple of days. Rising humidity levels is a good sign and would work as a catalyst for the onset of monsoon in the state, said experts. A pleasant morning was witnessed in Jaipur as a minimum temperature of 27.8 degree Celsius was recorded. Also, rainfall of 11 mm provided relief to the people in the city from simmering hot conditions. In the afternoon amidst clouds a maximum temperature of 37.4, almost 4 degrees below the normal notch was recorded. In the evening people rushed to various hang-out joints to enjoy the pleasant weather. Many places in the state witnessed mild to moderate showers including Lakshmangarh (Sikar) and Gogunda (Udaipur) where a rainfall of 50 mm was received. It was followed by Sikrai (Dausa) and Nawalgarh (Jhunjhunu) where 40 mm rainfall was recorded. Likewise, many places in the eastern and western parts of the state also witnessed a rainfall ranging from 40 mm to 10 mm. In its forecast Jaipur Met office said that mild to moderate showers will continue in the eastern and western Rajasthan for next couple of days.
