Silver bars with golden polish seized in.description: JAISALMER: Nachna police on Saturday night while patrolling recovered 10.068kg of yellow metal bars from a person who claimed it to be made of gold. Each bar weighed 1kg. Later police found out that the bars were of silver that had a fine covering of gold polish. The accused perhaps was to deliver them to someone by claiming these to be of gold. Police are questioning him but till now he has not been able to give satisfactory answers. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Dholpur cops alert counterparts in MP, U.description: JAIPUR: Police who are involved in combing operations in Dholpur ravines to nab notorious dacoit Jagan Gujjar have also intimated their counterparts in Uttar Pradesh and Madhya Pradesh areas that are close to Dholpur. Senior police officers said that Jagan is now on their radar and would be arrested soon as they have some concrete information on the possible temporary hideout of the dacoit. Since Jagan and his men allegedly stripped the women and children of a family at gunpoint and paraded them naked last week after coming out on bail, at least two SP rank officers along with hundreds of policemen in the ravines of Dholpur and Karauli are into combing operation of the ravines. Amidst the operation they are also getting misleading information which is possibly being given by Jagan’s aides. However, police are not moving an inch without verifying information coming to them from various channels. TOI on Monday spoke to various officers involved in the search operation of Jagan Gujjar. “He is not too far from us. We have also intimated our counterparts in Bhind (MP), Murena (MP), Shivpuri (MP) and Agra (UP) which are close to Dholpur. Bandits of ravines have been on and off to the neighbouring states in search of safer hideouts, especially on higher altitudes in the ravines,” said a senior police officer on condition of anonymity. Inspector general of police, Bharatpur range, Bhupendra Sahu has also intimated neighbouring states – MP and UP police. “Various teams are working round-the-clock to get closer to him. It is too early to say what we have, but yes he would be arrested soon,” Sahu added. A team of police has also gone to Bhind (MP), Murena (MP) and Shivpura (MP) to verify certain things related to Gujjar. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Poor functioning of city drainage system.description: Jaipur: After the first spell of showers concerns are being raised about the functionality of the drainage systems or its lack in the city. Open potholes and manholes have also come as a cause for worry as they get blocked with garbage and then over flow. “The main roads are good as compared to the smaller lanes because the government focuses on them. The smaller lanes always get filled up with muck and water during monsoons and cause difficulties to residents and commuters. We also see a lot of accidents happening on these roads because of water logging,” said Karan Raj Sharma, a resident of Choti Chaupar. And it is not only the damaged roads but also the unattended pits made by workers that create problems for people. Bhagyashree Kalia, a resident of Pratap Nagar, said, “The drainage system around our locality is not efficient. Even after light showers drains get blocked and water gets collected on the side of the road. These small pools of water harbour mosquitoes and often emit a foul smell over a period of time. Local authorities did repair a few broken roads some time back but many of these roads have returned to their earlier state.” Residents have also time and again complained that the bare electric wires that are hanging loose from electric poles and sometimes also lying on the roads or pavements can cause a major problem during monsoons. These live wires come in contact with water and may electrocute it, making it fatal for the people, animals as well as vehicles passing the area. The month of June is half gone but the work of desilting the drains is still not complete. There are around 827 small drains in the city and about 20 big drains. Though Jaipur Municipal Corporation (JMC) claimed that more than 700 small drains have been desilted but tenders for the remaining bigger drains have not yet been floated. An official at the JMC said that the formalities for the tender have been completed and it will be floated soon. “Because of the Lok Sabha elections held this year, a moral code of conduct was applied so no tenders were issued and no work could be done. Due to this cleaning of the sewerage and drainage system got delayed. Work which had to be done 2-3 months in advance is being done now. We can only wish that there is not much problem during the monsoon.” a source in JMC told TOI. However, not all areas are in such a dismal condition. Work has been done in certain parts and is being appreciated by the residents. Alisha Varghese, a resident of Gujjar Ki Thadi, said, “The government is trying to improve water logging conditions. We now have cemented roads that are less prone to damage. They have also made a separate canal for drains. The problem of water logging has also been solved.” Apart from the problems faced by traffic, pedestrians are also at risk because of the water filled roads as manholes are not visible and they may fall into them. These potholes and dysfunctional drainages are threat to citizens’ lives. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

CM Ashok Gehlot reminds PM of poll promi.description: JAIPUR: Chief minister Ashok Gehlot reminded PM Narendra Modi of his promise made during the election rallies, of making Eastern Rajasthan Canal Project (ERCP) a national project, while speaking at the 5th Governing Council Meeting of NITI Aayog, held in Delhi on Saturday. “This project is expected to supply drinking water to 13 districts of Rajasthan and make irrigation water available for an additional two lakh hectares of land. It is high time to keep that promise and approve this project at the earliest,” said Gehlot. The CM made a strong pitch, seeking Centre’s support in the development of drinking water, rainwater harvesting, agriculture, drought management, health. He asked the Centre to immediately release the first instalment of Rs 370 crore for the year for the National Rural Drinking Water Project. Gehlot sought financial aid worth Rs 1,454 crore for Phase 3 of Rajiv Gandhi Lift Canal Project. “This project is intended to supply drinking water to 2014 villages and five towns of Jodhpur, Barmer and Pali districts up to year 2051. Also, financial aid for the linking of Brahmani river to Bisalpur Dam for drinking water supply for Jaipur, Ajmer, Tonk and Nagaur districts.” The CM demanded that the NITI Aayog should take the responsibility of the special rail projects other than the cost of land acquisition, which should be borne by the states. “On this basis, Ratlam-Dungarpur via Banswara railway line should be initiated,” he added. He further requested that Dholpur-Sarmathura broad-gauge line should be started soon along with an extension of route upto Gangapur City. The CM also demanded that the Union ministries should remove various procedural hurdles in releasing the funds for the Centrally-sponsored schemes. He further requested for strengthening the federal structure of the country by providing more rights to the states in utilization of funds provided by the Centre. He also apprised the Niti Aayog team that recently, the state government framed a law to provide exemption from any kind of permission for first three years to the MSME units. This would provide a favourable environment to the entrepreneurs. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Inter-disciplinary approach helps econom.description: Jaipur: Economists shape social, political and foreign policy of every country. The US president removed India from the GSP beneficiary list which has put Indian economists on the job to study its implications. The assessment by economists on this subject will further shape India’s relation with its old time ally. Of late, students have realised the growing importance of this subject which is the reason behind admissions in economics have become tough with each passing year. It is a science with inter-disciplinary approach and goes hand in hand with governments, businesses, societies, households and individuals. In the last two decades, the concepts of economics have been prominently merged in several subjects like public policy, healthcare, diplomacy and law which has made it a highly job oriented course. Governments rely on the views put by the economists to understand and create laws that deal with crime, family, education, health care. Economics, as a subject, is offered by Rajasthan University as masters in economics, MPhil in economics while Maharani’s College and Rajasthan College offer BA (pass course) and BA (honours). Economics, as an optional subject, is also offered at Maharaja’s College and Commerce College. Students are eligible for a master’s degree after completing their graduation. Rameshwar Jat, an associate professor of economics in Rajasthan University said, “Economics is a technical subject which mainly focuses on market’s demand and supply, it uses rigorous statistical analysis to analyse the changes. It is known as the physics of social sciences. Due to the change in trends the horizon of economics has widened, it now also focuses on the international relations based on the economy of a country. Since then, a concept of political economics has also been discovered. It also develops conceptual models of behaviour to predict responses to changes in policy and market conditions. The study of economics provides valuable knowledge which can also be used in our daily life.” He added, “Due to a boom in the technical field, students are more interested in economics now. It not only covers basic theory but also includes models, data analytics and econometrics which revolve around interpretation and forecasting of data. Students with a liking towards practical subjects should opt for economics.” Economics is an application based subject which keeps a student occupied. It helps students to decipher the information about ongoing economic developments. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Satta King 2019.description: NEW DELHI: Satta Matka is a form of gambling or lottery that had originated before the Independence of India.Originally, the game of Matka gambling involved betting on the opening and closing rates of cotton as transmitted to the Bombay Cotton Exchange from the New York Cotton Exchange, via teleprinters.The modern-day Matka gambling/ Satta King is based on random number selection and betting. The players participating in the Satta Matka game/ gambling are required to choose the right number for winning the game. The player who wins the game becomes Satta King and is rewarded financially. Two of the most famous Matka games are - Kalyan and Worli. The Kalyan Matka gambling was started by Kalyanji Bhagat, a farmer from Gujarat, in 1962 and it ran for all days of the week. Another Matka gambling, New Worli Matka, was started by the Rattan Khatri in 1964 with slight modifications to the rules of the game. Khatri’s Matka ran only five days a week, from Monday to Friday.The modern Matka business is centred around Maharashtra.Some of the terms used in the game and their meaning is given below:    Term Meaning   Matka Matka means earthen pot that were used to draw numbers   Single Any digit between 0 and 9   Jodi/Pair Any pair of two digits between 00 and 99    Patti/Panna Three digit number    Open result / close result Outcome of matka betting   Berij Berij is last digit of jodi's/pair's sum The Google 2018 trends data shows that 'satta' and 'matka' were the top searched words in the Madhya Pradesh state in the year 2018. As per the Google data, 'satta' was the 4th most searched word with a score of 36 and 'matka' came 6th with a score of 23.Any form of Satta Matka gambling is illegal in India.Disclaimer: This content is for reference purpose only and The Times of India claims no ownership of this content. The Times of India does not support or promote piracy in any manner.Download The Times of India News App for Latest India News.

Encephalitis.description: Bihar is in the grip of Encephalitis. At least 108 children have lost their lives due to acute encephalitis syndrome (AES) in its Muzaffarpur district. AES accompanies flu-like symptoms such as high fever, headaches and convulsions. Japanese encephalitis virus (JEV) is the major cause of AES in India besides other sources such as bacteria, fungus, parasites, spirochetes, chemicals, toxins, and non infectious agents. Here's more. Tyre mgmt startup Fleeca eyes 2nd round.description: JAIPUR: After raising pre-series a funding round from Innovana Thinklabs last December, Jaipur-based tyre management startup Fleeca is scouting for more funds to expand network of service centres critical to its “cost-per-km” model that it is developing. Currently, the three-year-old startup that employs over 100 people is managing 50,000 tyres of 55 heavy commercial vehicle fleet owners in eight states offering retreading and refurbishing services to improve their longevity and increase second life. Though founder and CEO of Fleeca India Pvt Ltd Tikam Chand Jain declined to share the fund size it wants to raise citing valuation issues, he said the funds would be ploughed in to expand the Fleeca centres across the country before it goes full throttle on the cost-per-km model. “After fuel, tyre is biggest part of the operation cost for commercial vehicles. Through our management, we enhance mileage by 15-20%. If tyres are retreaded at the right time, they can run for more than half the life of the new ones. We have around 50 retreading centres in different cities and want to expand. We are talking to some big ecosystem players and expect the funding to materialise in next two months,” said Jain. Unlike the services it currently offers, Fleeca, through the cost-per-km model,would own the tyres and fleet owners will have to pay as per the distance clocked. “We have already started a pilot of the model for a company. In this model, tyres are owned by us and the owner of the fleet pays as per the distance clocked. To expand this vertical, which is going to be our core area of operation, we need to have more Fleeca centres on the highways where the tyres will be inspected, repaired and retreaded. Also there would be other facilities for the drivers. We already have 15 such centres but need capital to spread the footprint,” added Jain. Fleeca is currently working on a software with the use of artificial intelligence and internet of things that can predict the condition of tyres in advance. “We have tied up with IIT-Gandhinagar for developing the sensor-based technology,” added Jain. Lok Sabha Elections in Tamil Nadu.description: NEW DELHI: Tamil Nadu goes to polls in the second phase of the seven-phase elections. Elections to 39 parliamentary seats will take place on April 18 in a single-phase polling. Lok Sabha elections 2019: Get all live updatesTOP CONTENDERSThe four-cornered contest features AIADMK-led National Democratic Alliance (NDA), its chief rival DMK-led Secular Progressive Alliance (SPA), actor Kamal Haasan's Makkal Needhi Maiam and TTV Dhinakaran's Amma Makkal Munnetra Kazhagam (AMMK). This time the elections are taking place sans the Dravidian stalwarts M Karunanidhi and J Jayalalithaa. AIADMK chief Jayalalithaa passed away in December 2016 while Karunanidhi died in August 2018. While the DMK is contesting on 20 seats, the Congress is fighting elections on 9 seats in Tamil Nadu. In the AIADMK-BJP alliance, the national party will be contesting from five seats in the state while the PMK will be contesting from seven. Tamil Nadu Lok Sabha elections: Get all live updatesHOW MANY SEATS?Tamil Nadu has 39 Lok Sabha seats and one in neighbouring Puducherry. Here is the list of constituencies: Arakkonam, Arani, Chennai Central, Chennai North, Chennai South, Chidambaram(SC), Coimbatore, Cuddalore, Dharmapuri, Dindigul, Erode, Kallakurichi, Kancheepuram(SC), Kanyakumari, Karur, Krishnagiri, Madurai, Mayiladuthurai, Nagapattinam(SC), Namakkal Nilgiris(SC), Perambalur, Pollachi, Ramanathapuram, Salem, Sivaganga, Sriperumbudur, Tenkasi(SC), Thanjavur, Theni, Thiruvallur(SC), Thoothukudi, Tiruchirapalli, Tirunelveli, Tiruppur, Tiruvannamalai, Vellore, Villupuram(SC), Virudhunagar, Puducherry(Union Territory) KEY CONSTITUENCIESThe key constutuencies include Sivaganga, Chennai South, Chennai North, Chennai Central, Chidambaram(SC), Coimbatore, Cuddalore, Dharmapuri, Dindigul, Kanyakumari, Karur, Thoothukudi , Nilgiris(SC), Trichy, Vellore amd Arani. \nGlamour galore at Jaipur wedding\n.description: At the sangeet and ring ceremony of film distributor Raj Bansal’s son Abhimanyu in Jaipur, Bollywood celebs Sanjay Dutt with wife Maanayata and kids, Rishi Kapoor and Tanishaa Mukerji were seen in attendance. They’re in town to attend Abhimanyu and Suvarna’s wedding. Hosted at a farmhouse, the evening began with a sangeet ceremony where the family members of the bride and groom presented dance performances. The couple too performed to a medley of songs.  Rishi Kapoor was among the first few guests to reach the venue before the ceremony started. Sanjay Dutt along with his family reached quite late and was reportedly expected to present a dance performance to his song Tamma Tamma Loge, but that did not happen. However, the song kept playing in the backdrop. Tanishaa performed at the groom’s residence during the mehndi ceremony. She told us, “This is the first wedding I’m attending in Jaipur and everything looks so majestic. I’m enjoying every bit of it. Now I know why the city is a hot destination for weddings.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Counselling centres in Sanskrit colleges.description: JAIPUR: In a bid to revive Sanskrit language, the state technical and higher education department has directed the universities and Sanskrit colleges to open counselling centres for students to provide various job opportunities. The decision came during the inter-department meeting chaired by minister Subhash Garg. “This is the most underrated and misunderstood subject in the country. The opportunities around Sanskrit language are spread across the globe. Students should be made aware about how understanding of Sanskrit language can unravel several mysteries in the fields of science, business and philosophy,” said Garg. The department has also decided to observe Sanskrit Divas on August 14 across the state. The day will be marked by several functions including a state level function to honour those who contributed in spreading the language. The meeting was attended by the officials of college education directorate, school education, Ayurveda and higher education. The minister has also approved the formation of Vedic Sanskar Board (VSB) in the state. “A committee has been formed to look into its aims, objectives and road map of the VSB. The board’s task is to spread the ancient wisdom with special emphasis on the Vedas. The board will soon become operational,” said Garg. The department has also made an announcement of organizing an international conference on Sanskrit by inviting renowned Sanskrit scholars from across the globe. “The event will mark the beginning of new ties with the West based on the common understanding of evolving the various aspect of Sanskrit,” said Garg. Sharks of illegal bajri trade remain elu.description: The police have arrested several dumper drivers transporting bajri, but the top bosses of the trade continue to evade the police and mining department’s net. Many mining dens, operating alongside riverbanks and bajri mandi are breeding grounds for smuggling, yet no action has been taken against them yet. “Police alone does not have the power of the mandate to crack a whip on mining operations. We can simply provide a complete backing to the mining department,” an official told TOI, adding that even in Kardhani case, where an elderly citizen, Kishore Singh was mowed to death on Wednesday, the mining department was alerted two days prior to that, about a thriving mandi in the area. When asked about Singh’s case, the sources told TOI that while the driver, Jagdish who killed Singh was arrested on Thursday, the truck’s owner remains at large. “The accused claimed he did not have a driving license. His owner is a former milkman who entered the illicit trade to make easy money. We have his whereabouts and making efforts to arrest him,” said the official. The police said that top bosses who extricate bajri from riverbed, either buy trucks on forged documents or hire it from somebody else on false pretext. “There is no organised gang which commands the illegal mining operation. Therefore, it is not easy to arrest them,” said a mining official. The police meanwhile hope that Jagdish’s arrest may help cops to deter others. “We have booked him under section 302 (murder) of the IPC, which is a very stringent section. It may help to deter others,” a police official said. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

\nMusic and food on their mind: Sanam ba.description: "Jaipur is always fun to visit," says lead vocalist Sanam Puri of band Sanam, as they were in Jaipur recently to perform at a private gig in the outskirts of the city. "This is not our first time. We have done a number of private events in Jaipur earlier. The weather is simply amazing during this time of the year. We performed to a lovely crowd of music aficionados (old and young). Our challenge was to make sure that we keep people of all ages entertained and hooked. Thus, we made our set list accordingly. Overall, it was a great experience being in Jaipur," he shares. With a chock-a-block schedule, the members of the band did not get enough time to explore Jaipur. Sanam says, "We reached in the daytime and straightaway headed for the sound check. Then, we got back, worked on our set list, got ready and left for the show. After the show, we did manage to eat some delicious Rajasthani food. The food was little on the spicy side but that did not stop us from gorging on the delectable food served to us. I love Jaipur ka khana." Venkat S, the bass guitarist, quips, "I love laal maans. I think it is something to die for; it’s heaven on the plate." Keshav Dhanraj, the drummer says, "I think we come to Jaipur mostly just to eat. Every time we come here, we are occupied with sound check and our show. So the only thing that we do is to gorge on Jaipur’s food and enjoy the weather."  To which Sanam jokingly adds, "This is so true. We are big-time foodies. Agar humein khaane ke liye paise milte to hum sab kitne rich hote." Venkat says that the next time when they come to the city, they would love to move around like any other tourist and see the rich heritage that the city boasts of.  On Friday, the band came up with their new song, Sanam Mennu. Sharing the idea behind the song, Venky S, says that the song has been composed keeping Valentine's Day in mind. He adds, "It's our first release this year and is our original composition. It's a light-hearted song about something most people go through while in a relationship. Since, we are four boys, the song is obviously from a boy's perspective. This is our Valentine's Day special song and we hope that everyone will relate to the lyrics and tune of this song."  (L-R) Venky S, Samar Puri, Sanam Puri and Keshav Dhanraj , members of Sanam bandThe band, Sanam, is known for its renditions of retro classics apart from their original compositions. We ask them if there are any factors that they take into consideration when they choose a retro song. To which Keshav replies that there are no factors as such. However, whichever old classic they decide to revamp, they make sure to not change the soul and melody of the song. "We grew up listening to some beautifully composed and well-written songs, an art that seems to have lost its way these days. Most of the newer music we hear today lacks the soul and complex compositions that we enjoyed listening to. As a band, we decided to make our own renditions of these amazing songs so that the newer generations can get a chance to listen to some well written and composed creations. Our renditions also connect with the older audiences because they get to hear their favourite songs presented to them in a new light. We give it our own sound and flavour, but the soul of the song remains intact."  Opening up on creative differences within the members of the band, vocalist Sanam says, "Each of us has different musical background and enjoys listening to different styles of music. The fact that we have different ideas and creative processes, helps keep our sound unique. We respect each other’s ideas and make sure that we only release a song once all of us are completely satisfied with it. Also, we work on things together so we are always open to trying different options before settling on anything."  Sanam band during their performance Talking about Rajasthani folk music, Keshav shares, "We find Rajasthani folk music interesting. There are so many unique instruments like the khartal, ravanahatha, alghoza, sarangi etc. that are used. We have a playlist on our Youtube channel only for regional music. So far, we have not attempted a Rajasthani song. But we hope to collaborate with some musicians and singers from Rajasthan to make some interesting renditions of the state's folk music. Personally, I really want to learn how to play the khartal." In Video:Music and food on their mind: Sanam band woos Jaipur's old and young alikeDownload The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Gold worth Rs 23 Lakh recovered from thr.description: JAISALMER: Customs department at Munabao Railway Station on Saturday night recovered 700.167gm gold from three Pakistani citizens who had come by Thar Express. The market value of the recovered gold is Rs 23,27,119. Those detained were earlier too involved in gold smuggling incidents. Apart from this, 300 women’s kurtas and 200 dupattas were also recovered from another Pakistani citizen who was travelling to Pakistan by the train. Assistant commissioner (customs) ML Shera said that the gold seized was in form of 10 tolas of five biscuits and a bangle of 81.6gm and three rings of 35.1gm.  These were recovered from Pakistani citizens Kishore Kumar Maheshwari, Ramesh and Kailash Mali. Earlier on Saturday morning when luggage of passengers going to Pakistan was searched, Ramchandra, resident of Hyderabad had around 300 women’s kurtas and 200 dupattas worth Rs 1.50 lakh. The officials seized them provisions of Custom Act and Rs 52,500 was collected as penalty. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Not aware of sand mafia-government nexus.description: JAIPUR: A day after Rajasthan DGP Kapil Garg admitted that sand mafia was flourishing in the state with the help of government machinery, state mining minister Pramod Bhaya said, “He was not aware of such a thing,” while stating that, “The Congress government has taken ‘immediate action’ against all the cases which have been reported.” Meanwhile, Jaipur district administration, after forming several teams to curb illegal sand mining, has seized 12 vehicles including 10 tractors, and two JCBs. One FIR has been registered at Nindar police station. Asked about the DGP's observation, Bhaya said, "Every person has a viewpoint of his own. I am not aware of such a thing. But, we take immediate action against those cases as and when we receive a complaint of illegal sand mining." "After Congress came to power, we have seized many vehicles and resources apart from penalising a number of people. Many FIRs have also been lodged. As and when the department (mining) gets information about illegal sand mining from anywhere, it takes immediate action. We have tried our best to stop illegal sand mining," he added. Jaipur collector Jagroop Yadav said 12 vehicles (10 tractors and two dumpers) and two JCBs have been seized in areas like Dudu, Sanganer and other places. "One FIR has been registered at Nindar police station, where two JCBs were seized. A case has been registered against four persons," said Yadav. "The RTO has been directed to hand over the seized vehicles coming from Tonk and Sawai Madhopur to the these teams," he added. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Nominations for handloom artisans\u2019.description: JAIPUR: Industries minister Parsadi Lal Meena announced on Sunday that handloom artisans will be awarded for their contribution by the state government. Nominations for the award must be filed by June 30, 2019 at district industries department. Artisans will be first awarded at district level and later on, the first and second awardees names will be sent for state level competition. Artisans with an experience of three years will be selected for this award. t state level, first prize will be Rs 21,000, second Rs 11,000 and third will be Rs 7,100. Jaipur: Doctors to form human chain at S.description: JAIPUR: To express solidary with their colleagues agitating in Kolkata, doctors will form human chain at Sawai Man Singh Medical College in the city on Sunday. Doctors will gather at around 6am to form the human chain, said Dr Rashim Kataria, secretary, Medical College Teachers Association of Rajasthan (MCTAR). MCTAR’s secretary Dr Pawan Singhal said they will gather to protest to express their support to the protesting doctors in Kolkata. They claimed that the call of MCTAR to form human chain has also been supported by other doctors’ association including Medical College Teachers Association, All Rajasthan In Service Doctors Association, Indian Medical Association, Jaipur Medical Association, Medical Practitioners Society, Private Hospitals and Nursing Home Society, Jaipur Association of Resident Doctors and UG medical students’ union. They have circulated the message among their fraternity saying, “All Under graduates, post graduates, Interns, resident doctors, Medical officers, faculty members, consultants, doctors from private sector, corporate hospitals and nursing homes, self-employed too are requested to come together for the formation of human chain at SMS Medical College.” They have also appealed to the doctors to come with family and friends, bring your water bottles and make it a total nonviolent agitation. They also sent the message that during formation of human chain they have to maintain the cleanliness and they appealed doctors to reach the spot in apron. BJP List 2019 Tamilnadu.description: CHENNAI: The BJP's Tamil Nadu candidates list announced on Thursday was on expected lines, with Union minister Pon Radhakrishnan being fielded from Kanyakumari, state chief Tamilisai Soundararajan in Tuticorin, national secretary H Raja in Sivaganga, C P Radhakrishnan in Coimbatore and vice-president Nainar Nagendran in Ramanathapuram. While Pon Radhakrishnan and Raja will fight Congress, which is yet to name candidates for its nine seats in DMK alliance, Tamilisai will cross swords with DMK heavyweight Kanimozhi in Tuticorin. H Raja to contest from Sivaganga for third timeH Raja is contesting from Sivaganga for the third time. In 2014, he came third with 1.33 lakh votes, while in 1999, he came second. It will be a keenly fought battle between Tamilisai and DMK’s state women wing secretary and Rajya Sabha MP K Kanimozhi in Tuticorin. Though Tamilisai initially preferred to contest from Chennai South, which has a sizeable votebank for the party, she finally settled for Tuticorin. AIADMK was keen on retaining south Chennai for sitting MP, J Jayavardhan, son of fisheries minister D Jayakumar. Former TN BJP chief Radhakrishnan will face CPM’s P R Natarajan in Coimbatore. This is the fifth time that Radhakrishnan has been fielded in Coimbatore, a BJP stronghold. While he won two consecutive Lok Sabha elections in 1998 and 1999, he was defeated in the 2004 and 2014 polls. Nainar Nagendran has been pitted against DMK’s IUML candidate K Nawaz Kani. While the party made a quick decision on candidates for four constituencies, Ramanathapuram delayed matters considering the keen contest for the seat among some senior leaders. Jaya Prada.description: HYDERABAD: It’s been a roller coaster ride for actress Jaya Prada in politics. The actress, who started off as a Telugu film heroine dominating the scene along with Sridevi some decades ago, changed her political course on Tuesday by joining the BJP. In the last 25 years of her political career, she has changed several parties. Hailing from Rajahmundry in Andhra Pradesh, she began her political career with the Telugu Desam Party in 1994 as she had done several films alongside TDP founderpresident N T Rama Rao. After N Chandrababu Naidu took over as chief minister, he nominated her to the Rajya Sabha and she served a term from 1996-2002. While in the TDP, Jaya Prada had a running feud with Renuka Chowdhary who was also in the TDP then. When it became clear that she was being ignored in the TDP, Jaya Prada looked for greener pastures elsewhere. The Samajwadi Party led by Mulayam Singh Yadav in Uttar Pradesh got Jaya Prada into its party fold. She contested the Rampur Lok Sabha seat from that state on the SP ticket and won in 2004. In the 2009 elections, she got re-elected from the same constituency. With differences sprouting between SP leader Amar Singh and Mulayam Singh Yadav, Jaya prada had to make a choice on who she would sail with. She preferred to join the new party that Amar Singh floated but that proved to be a futile exercise. Jaya Prada then joined the Rashtriya Janata Dal, led by Ajit Singh in UP, making the move along with Amar Singh. In the 2014 elections she was fielded as an LS candidate from Bijnor but lost. For some time, there was speculation that Jaya Prada would return to the Telugu Desam Party when she met Andhra Pradesh chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu in Amaravati in November 2015. It turned out that she had met Naidu only to invite him for her son Siddharth’s wedding that month in Hyderabad. In 2013, Jaya Prada had met Congress president Sonia Gandhi and that also led to speculation that she would join the Congress. She had even announced that she was interested in getting back to her home state and would continue her political career there. She was keen on returning to AP politics but nothing concrete materialised. On Tuesday, she was welcomed into the BJP at the party’s headquarters in Delhi. “I am working with a brave leader in whose hands India is safe,” she said about Modi. 45-year-old trader shot dead in Sawai Ma.description: JAIPUR: A 45-year-old trader was shot dead by two armed and masked assailants in broad daylight near Shukla circle at Khandar town of Sawai Madhopur district of the state. It was a murder for gain since the robbers decamped with a cash bag containing nearly Rs 4 lakh. Police have detained two suspects in this connection which were handed over to the police by villagers. The deceased identified as Kadu Garg had gone to withdraw some money. At 12.30 pm on Monday when he returned on a bike and was parking his bike near his shop two armed and masked assailants opened fire and snatched away the cash bag containing nearly Rs 4 lakh. “He sustained two bullet injuries including one in the abdomen and one bullet got stuck in his ribs. He was rushed to the government hospital in Sawai Madhopur. In the evening he succumbed to the injuries in the hospital,” said a senior police officer of Sawai Madhopur. Locals alleged that the police reached the spot almost 45 minutes after the incident despite the fact that the police station was merely 2 kms away. It may be recalled that the elder brother of the deceased, Dilip Garg, too had witnessed firing on him four years ago but he escaped unhurt. Meanwhile, some locals claimed that they have nabbed the assailants behind the murder and have handed them over to the police. “We are verifying various facts and interrogating two detained persons. Villagers claimed that two bikers while moving very fast triggered air fire after which the villagers nabbed them,” the officer added. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Tejashwi Yadav.description: PATNA/ BHAGALPUR: RJD chief Lalu Prasad’s younger son and leader of opposition in Bihar legislative assembly Tejashwi Prasad Yadav kicked off the Lok Sabha election campaign on Monday by addressing public meetings at Gaya, Banka and Bhagalpur in support of the Mahagathbandhan candidates. Close aides of Tejashwi said he is expected to address around 200 election meetings across the state over the next two months. “Tejashwi is the face of RJD and the star campaigner of Mahagathbandhan. He will be canvassing for candidates of all the Mahagathbandhan constituents — RJD, Congress, RLSP, HAM(S) and VIP. Thus, he will be addressing three to four election meetings every day,” Tejashwi’s political adviser Sanjay Yadav told TOI on Monday. Canvassing for RJD candidate Shailesh Kumar alias Bulo Mandal from Bhagalpur, Tejashwi came down heavily on NDA governments at the Centre and in state. He accused PM Narendra Modi of making false promises and propaganda to win the 2014 general election. “It won’t be repeated in the ensuing Lok Sabha elections,” Tejashwi said while raising questions about employment scenario and issues of Vijay Malaya, Nirav Modi, Mehul Chowksi and others who fled the country after swindling money from banks in India. Criticizing Nitish for snapping ties with RJD in 2017, Tejashwi said there was acute shortage of fertilizers, while the health services were also in a poor state. He accused deputy CM Sushil Kumar Modi of protecting those involved in the multi-crore Srijan scam in Bhagalpur and some other districts. Urging the audience to vote for the RJD candidate, Tejashwi said the Bhagalpur voters had showed a mirror to Modi by voting for RJD in 2014. “They should do the same this election as the NDA government stands exposed,” he said. Political observers feel Tejashwi has become a good orator, especially after coming out of power in July 2017 when CM Nitish Kumar snapped ties with RJD-led Mahagathbandhan and rejoined BJP-led NDA. “Though not as good as his father in terms of having a rustic touch, Tejashwi is a good orator in terms of eloquence,” said DM Diwakar, political observer and professor at AN Sinha Institute of Social Studies. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

City\u2019s PG facilities popular among.description: JAIPUR: After applying for admissions in universities and colleges, students begin the endless search for hostels that meet their budget and required facilities. Finding an ideal hostel is an uphill task for the outstation students who run from one area to another in the city. TOI scanned areas like Raja Park, Gopalpura Bypass, Mansarover, C-Scheme and Bani Park which are hub for hostels and rented accommodations . Raja Park turned out to be the most popular destination for students for hostels and paying guest (PG) accommodation. Its closeness to several institutes has made the area most preferred and expensive. Eateries that have come up in the last three years have also added to its popularity. Some high-end hostels which are fully air-conditioned, have thumb impression regulated entry and exit, RO water, round-the-clock security, Wi-Fi, dining space, multi-cuisine food, in-house party area, doctor on call that charge from Rs 8,000 to 25,000. Rita Kharbanda of Vatsalya Hostel who has 100 rooms in different locations in Raja Park, said, “The first thing that parents and students look for is safety. Girls and women can go for a walk till late in the night.” Mansarovar and Gopalpura Bypass are other popular areas for the PG accommodation. These areas have easy connectivity to educational institutes and coaching centres. Since the area is wide several families have started subletting extra rooms of their houses to the students. Pragya Bhatnagar, a resident of Triveni Nagar, said, “We sublet rooms to girls. Generally, three to four girls stay in a room and most of them prepare for competitive exams like SSC, RAS. There are no security issues in the colony as it is a residential area with CCTV cameras.” Almost all the PGs are very particular about the timings and impose restrictions on the students. Generally, the time limit is till 10pm and after that the students are not allowed to enter the hostel. They follow proper safety guidelines. Ankita Singh, owner of a girl's PG in C-Scheme, said, “We have both students and working professionals. Jaipur is still an orthodox city so we are very particular about cleanliness and timings. We don’t allow girls to enter and exit the premises after 9.30pm unless it is urgent. We keep their parents or local guardians in loop. The rent ranges from Rs 7,000 to 8,000 for double sharing rooms and Rs 5,000 to 6,000 for triple sharing rooms.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

SMS registers more patients on Monday.description: JAIPUR: It was a difficult day for 70-year-old Hukum Singh from Gangapur of Sawai Madhopur, who reached Jaipur early Monday morning with his ailing 72-year-old brother Khelan Singh. Last time, when he came to Sawai Man Singh Hospital, doctors had told him that they would admit Khelan for his treatment. But when they reached the out-patient department (OPD) on Monday, they found their treating doctor missing from the OPD. “There is a wound on his leg and brown pus is continuously spurting from the wound. There is no one to admit him,” said Hukum Singh, a farmer of Gangapur area, while his elder brother was lying on the floor at the OPD of SMS Hospital waiting for medical assistance. Bandikui’s Ram Narayan, who came to the hospital with his brother for his jaundice treatment, said, “Last week my brother remained admitted to the hospital and blood was transfused. The doctor told me to come for a follow-up but the treating doctor is not available.” Despite the announcement of strike by various doctors’ associations, patients kept pouring in at the hospital in rising numbers. The number of patients that turned up at the hospital was much higher than it registers every day. The daily average registration of patients at SMS Hospital is 8,047, but on Monday, 8,240 patients were registered. Considering the rush of patients at the hospital, a section of doctors attended to OPD patients. At the SMS hospital, while resident doctors remained on strike, medical teachers including assistant professors, associate professors, senior residents and medical officers took care of the patients in the OPD. The medical teachers had decided to boycott work earlier. They had boycotted work for two hours from 8 am to 10 am. When they realised that there was a huge rush of patients, they decided to resume work for the benefit of the patients. “The medical services were not completely hit as medical college teachers, few senior resident doctors and medical officers gave their services,” said Dr D S Meena, medical superintendent, SMS Hospital. The doctors performed surgeries and they also admitted patients who required immediate attention. At the SMS hospital, 116 surgeries were performed against a daily average of 284 operations per day. Also, indoor patient department also remained affected as 303 patients were admitted against the daily average of 584. Most patients who came in were unaware about the strike and included those from districts like Alwar, Sawai Madhopur, Dausa, Sikar. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Chandrababu Naidu.description: KURNOOL: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday launched a blistering attack on Andhra Pradesh chief minister and erstwhile ally N Chandrababu Naidu, calling him 'u-turn Babu', whose "intent" was not on state's development. Addressing a well-attended election rally here, he sought to reject Naidu's repeated attacks that his government neglected the state. Andhra Pradesh goes to siumultaneous elections to the 175-member assembly and 25 Lok Sabha seats in the first phase on April 11 with the BJP contesting them alone. Listing various initiatives taken by the NDA government for Andhra Pradesh, Modi said it was during his regime that the Vizag-Chennai industrial corridor was flagged off and approval for the first National Institute of Ocean Technology (NIOT) given. It was also the 'chowkidar' who cleared the first Indian Institute of Packaging (IIP) besides approving the greenfield petrochemical complex for the state, he said. "Five years ago, your one vote made me PM. Your Pradhan sewak worked selflessly day and night for the people of the country. Chowkidar kept the interest of the state in mind," he said. Modi also recalled that the NDA government sanctioned first central university in Anantpur. He accused Naidu, the Telugu Desam Party supremo, of pasting state government 'stickers' on the Central schemes. "For sure, I could have done more work. I just required the cooperation of the state government. I made all efforts from my side, but the person who is running the government (Naidu), his intention is not Andhra Pradesh's development," Modi said. Levelling charges of corruption and dynasty politics against Naidu, he said the election date of April 11 will usher in the "double engine" of the state's growth -- a BJP government both at the Centre and the state. There was debate going on in AP that there were 'schemes for corruption,' ranging from the creation of the new capital Amravati, the Prime Minister charged. "The people of Andhra Pradhesh know whose coffers are being filled.. when this chowkidar sought accounts, u-turn Babu took a u-turn from AP's growth and walked out from NDA," Modi lashed out. Naidu had snapped ties with the NDA in March last year, accusing the Centre of not honouring the "promised" special category status to Andhra Pradesh. Hitting out at the TDP supremo for getting close to the Congress, Modi said Naidu has "found friends who are on bail," apparently referring to Congress leaders Rahul Gandhi and Sonia Gandhi who are on bail in the National Herald case. Modi, who had in the past hit out at Naidu for alleged family politics, said the election should also see the "son set", and called for a new "sun rise." He deliberately stressed on the "son" part to drive home his point on dynasty politics targeting the AP chief minister and his son and state minister Nara Lokesh. Without elaborating, Modi mocked that Pakistan has now accepted Naidu's "friends" as "hero." Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

We need separate security forces for pro.description: JAIPUR: Doctors’ agitation, which emerged from West Bengal, has taken Rajasthan in its grip too. Doctors in private hospitals and nursing homes, as well as government doctors and resident doctors will boycott work for 24 hours in the state to express solidarity with agitating doctors in West Bengal.  Emergency services and care of already admitted patients will be excluded from this shutdown. In support of Indian Medical Association’s (IMA) call for a nationwide medical bandh, Private Hospitals and Nursing Homes Society (PHNHS) has declared a complete shutdown of all non-essential medical services, including OPD, elective surgeries and new admissions, from Monday 6am onwards to Tuesday 6am. “All private hospitals including corporate hospitals and nursing Homes, clinics and diagnostic centres will remain closed,” said Dr Vijay Kapoor, secretary, PHNHS. All Rajasthan In-Service Doctors’ Association (ARISDA), a body of government doctors posted in rural areas and district hospitals across the state, has also extended support to the agitating doctors of West Bengal. “The incidents of violence against doctors have become frequent in Rajasthan as well. We demand the government to form special security forces in hospitals for the security of doctors. ,” said Dr Ajay Chaudhary, president ARISDA. IMA’s state branch secretary Dr VK Jain said, “We protested peacefully but no action has been taken to fulfil our demands.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

AP BJP List 2019.description: NEW DELHI: The Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP), on Thursday, announced its first candidate list for the Lok Sabha elections 2019 that includes 184 candidates. The party has named two candidates from Andhra Pradesh in the first list. Kanna Lakshminarayana will contest from Narasaraopet Lok Sabha constituency while D Purandeshwari will contest from the Visakhapatnam seat. Andhra Pradesh will go to polls in a single phase on April 11. BJP's Lok Sabha first full list The Lok Sabha elections will be held in seven phases from April 11 to May 19, 2019. The counting of the votes has been scheduled for May 23. The first phase will be held on April 11, second on April 18, third on April 23 and fourth on April 29, fifth on May 6, sixth on May 12 and seventh phase on May 19. Prime Minister Narendra Modi will contest from Varanasi constituency, while BJP president Amit Shah will fight from Gandhinagar in place of L K Advani. As many as 90 crore electors, including 1.59 crore new voters aged 18-19 years, are registered to vote in the upcoming general election. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Four of family from Delhi killed in Bika.description: JAIPUR: Four people were killed when the car in which they were travelling collided head-on with a truck coming from the opposite direction at Lunkaransar of Bikaner district on Monday. The accident happened at around 4.15 pm. Those killed in the accident have been identified as Satish Kumar (42), Vikas Kumar (45), Dhruv Kumar (16) and Dev Kumar (12), all from a family. The police said that they were residents of Karol Bagh in Delhi. The accident happened on the Ganganagar-Suratgarh road, which is a two-lane stretch and the road does not have any divider at Lunkaransar. “They were coming from Ganganagar and heading towards Suratgarh. The truck was coming from Suratgarh. Their car rammed into the truck. The four of the same family died on the spot,” said Girdhari Lal, station house office, Lunkaransar. The police said that Satish and Vikas are brothers, while Dhruv was Satish’s son, Dev was Vikas’s son. The accident was so fierce that the car in which they were travelling got stuck under the truck. The four of the family remained trapped in the car. With the help of crane, police managed to take out bodies from the badly damaged car. The police said that they have informed the family and kept the bodies in government hospital in Lunkaransar. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

BJP List 2019 Karnataka.description: BENGALURU: The BJP on Thursday released its first list of 21 candidates from Karnataka, but it does not include the names of sitting MP Karadi Sanganna (Koppal) or late Union minister HN Ananth Kumar’s wife Tejaswini, who is widely tipped to be the candidate from Bengaluru South. The list names the 14 other sitting MPs, including Shobha Karandlaje (Udupi-Chikkamagalur) and Suresh Angadi (Belagavi) despite stiff opposition within the party and anti-incumbency against the two. Party leaders said they are baffled by the exclusion of Tejaswini’s name and are unaware of the reasons for her candidature being withheld. “We inaugurated her personal office on Thursday and were sure of her name being announced,” one leader said. Rumours — from “technical” errors to the possibility that her name would lead to comments on “dynasty politics” — are doing the rounds. Sanganna’s candidature was withheld as the BJP is waiting for the JD(S)-Congress coalition to name its candidate. With the possibility of former chief minister Siddaramaiah contesting, the BJP will require a stronger candidate. The party also decided not to announce its candidate for Mandya, but two Congress rebels — A Manju from Hassan and Umesh Jadhav from Kalaburagi — have been given tickets. BSY has his wayThe first list confirms that the BJP central leadership continues to repose faith in state party president and Lingayat strongman BS Yeddyurappa. The list features names of his son BY Raghavendra and several confidants. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Play 'Chandrama urf Chamku' delights Jai.description: On the completion of theatre workshop titled ‘New experiments in theatre’, a play titled Chandrama Singh Urf Chamku was staged at Rangayan auditorium of Jawahar Kala Kendra in Jaipur. The play has been written by Bhanu Bharti and directed by Abhishek Mudgal. The play was presented by Rang Mastaaney, a theatre group in Jaipur. The play’s story is inspired by Lu Xun’s Chinese novella, The True Story of Ah-Q.  A scene from the play (Shalini Maheshwari/BCCL)  Abhishek Mudgal, director of the play The story of the play revolves around a man named Chamku, who lives in a village called Ikbari. All the villagers disregard him, but he shakes off all humiliation and tries to live a happy life. Chamku has a habit of always bragging or boasting about himself and his accomplishments, real or imagined. This leads him into a lot of troubles, which is the premise of the play. Tikesh Kumawat played the role of Chamku in the play. In Video:Chandrama Singh play delights JaipuritesDownload The Times of India News App for Latest City .

\nJaipur party witnesses a musical swag!.description: A lively band performance titled Rock Rulez Chapter 5 was held at the lawns of Devraj Niwas (The Forresta Kitchen & Bar) recently. Youngsters grooved to peppy numbers belted out by the band, Night Wings III. The atmosphere was charged up as youngsters cheered for the band and danced their heart out. The sumptuous food at the event was like a cherry on the cake for the visitors. Said Maneish Devraj, MD and owner, “It was a wonderful night and we are glad Jaipur’s youngsters enjoyed the party. We will continue to host such parties in the coming days as well.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

\nRoyal grandeur on Jaipur roads\n.description: This is just spectacular!' That's how most foreign tourists reacted when they gathered at the Tripoliya Gate to witness the Teej procession. Trying their best to capture everything in their cameras, most of them were awestruck at the grandeur of the procession, which began from the Zanani Deorhi at City Palace. Organised by the Department of Tourism, Jaipur Municipal Corporation and City Palace, the event saw scores of folk artistes putting up a colourful show. Tourists Georgia and Elinor said, “We came only for two days and our tour guide suggested that we extended our stay to witness the Teej festivities. This is such a fantastic event. I love how the animals have been decorated with jewellery and finery .I don't think any other country has such traditions.“ What Alice Duckner from Washington DC enjoyed was relishing ghewar and applying mehndi on her hands. Duckner said, “With henna and ghewar, I am feeling a part of the festival. I'm taking such wonderful memories with me from this procession." Medical students Rory and Tom were surprised that the festival involved women fasting for the well-being of their husbands.Tom said, “We were amazed to learn that married women fast for the long life of their husbands. We don't have such festivals in Europe."Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

\u2018Thar Desert expanding since last 2.description: JAIPUR: The Thar Desert in Rajasthan is expanding with every passing year since the last 20 years towards a man-made catastrophe. A report by Central Arid Zone Research Institute (CAZRI) reveals that the spurt in economic activities in the desert districts has shattered the fragile landscape, impacting its residents directly. CAZRI shared the report to mark the World Day to Combat Desertification on June 17. This was compiled using multiple independent studies including the Indian Remote Sensing Satellite data 2015-16. The report made the astonishing claim that 14.88-million-hectare land in 12 western Rajasthan districts suffered from different kinds of land degradation contributing to desertification. The report has studied the features of desertification: wind erosion / deposition, water erosion, salinity/ alkalinity, waterlogging and vegetation degradation to conclude that the situation may take decades to reverse the damage. The report studied districts of Barmer, Bikaner, Jaisalmer, Churu, Ganganagar, Hanumangarh, Jodhpur, Jalore, Jhunjhunu, Nagaur, Pali and Sikar. “The biggest reason contributing to desertification turned out to be water erosion. Our report suggested that 64.69% mapped area is facing wind erosion. For instance, 10% of land degradation in districts like Barmer, Jaisalmer and Jodhpur is due to water erosion,” said O P Yadav, director, CAZRI. Explaining the reason why the sandy landscape existing from millions of years is facing the change only in the last few decades, the report explained that such landscapes are highly vulnerable to wind erosion and it is a universal phenomenon. “What made the situation worse is human-induced activities like fast urbanization, deforestation, mining, indiscriminate use of groundwater, rise in livestock population and the hot summers leading to evaporation. This has accelerated desertification,” said Yadav. Supporting their claim, the scientist says that western Rajasthan harbours a total domestic livestock population of nearly 30.18 million heads – an increase of 14.63 million heads (94.72%) over the 1956 Census figures. “The destruction of vegetative cover due to overgrazing, felling of trees, etc. have accelerated the removal of sediments from the catchment areas of waterbodies as well as loosening of farm soil,” said Yadav. Large-scale mining has been mapped in Jhunjhunu, Jalore, Jodhpur, Barmer for the minerals and building materials, which has impacted the equilibrium. The vegetation cover has gone forever, making the land vulnerable. The report added that the overall scenario has affected the agricultural productivity to a great extent. The introduction of water intensive and multiple crops have their adverse effects in the region. “The empirical data is still being collected to give exact mass land converted into desert,” said Yadav. The team of scientists are also accessing the damage being caused due to increasing vehicular traffic, construction of roads and canal and exploration of oil and gas. Cops, forest officials attacked in Alwar.description: ALWAR: The mining mafia in Alwar’s Khairthal village attacked the combined team of forest department and local police. The accused beat up the officials before speeding off with three tractors filled with stones. The police said that the incident took place when the forest officials had learnt of illegal stone mining near Khairthal. When the team seized three tractors and was heading back to Alwar, the men working for the mafia attacked them at 3.30 am on Saturday. The miscreants vandalised police and forest department’s vehicles and jeeps, forcing cops and forest teams to make a quick retreat. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

17 lakh more farmers to get benefits of.description: JAIPUR: Under the Pradhan Mantri Kisan Samman Nidhi (PM-KISAN)) scheme, 17 lakh more farmers would be benefitted in the state and their applications would be uploaded online by June 30 as the central government has extended the ambit of the scheme to all land-holding farmers. So far, 38.1 lakh farmers have submitted their applications online under the scheme. After the government's decision to extend the benefit, about 55 lakh farmers in the state are now eligible for benefits under the scheme. Under the PM-KISAN scheme, farmers will get annual assistance of Rs 6,000 in three equal instalments. Initially, only small and marginal farmers were eligible under this scheme but revised guidelines issued by the Centre has included large farmers as well. Rajasthan chief secretary D B Gupta reviewed the progress in implementation of the scheme and asked district collectors to upload the pending cases within a week. “The progress of some districts – Ajmer, Jaipur, Baran, Sirohi, Alwar, Pali, Barmer – was slow with regard to uploading of applications online. Now, the districts have been asked to upload the pending applications online in one week. They have also been asked to upload the applications of the rest 17 lakh farmers by June 30,” said an official. “The districts have also been directed to start a helpline number so that the farmers don’t face problems. Since there are 4-5 lakh farmers only in Barmer district, the collector has been asked to set up special camps to get the applications uploaded by the farmers at the earliest,” he added. Gupta said that applications of 34.50 lakh farmers have been uploaded on PM kisan portal, out of which 19.34 lakh applications have been verified and verification of the remaining 19 lakh applications will be done at the earliest. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Tejasvi Surya.description: BENGALURU: From a boy who was groomed by late Union minister H N Ananth Kumar and Tejaswini Ananth Kumar to becoming the challenge to the family’s control over Bengaluru South segment, Tejasvi Surya has come a long way.While expressing his gratitude to Kumar and his family, Surya says he is a stark example of the BJP’s intent to infuse young and new blood. You were a surprise choice for Bengaluru South. Did you expect this development?While I had feelers that there was something like this going around, I was quite happily savouring pani puri with my friends. To be honest I was overwhelmed and started tweeting about this. I only feel gratitude towards the party, which is facing a crucial election and has decided to take risk by fielding a youngster in such a prestigious seat. At 28, will you be able to fill the shoes of Kumar?Filling the shoes of Ananth Kumar is a far fetched thing for he was so gigantic. I only pray to God to give me strength, sincerity and earnestness to honestly work for the people of this constituency so that one day in the eyes of the people I can match up to Kumar’s contribution to the constituency. On lack of political experience, I have a well oiled party organisational machinery to support me with senior leaders there to hand hold me. So what is this election going to be for you?Primarily it is an election for PM Narendra Modi’s aspirational India. It is about the promise of a new and young India and I am just an ambassador of the message of this new India. It is a reflection of party and Modi’s inclination of bringing in young blood. Tejaswini not getting the ticket is quite sensitive...Yes it is sensitive but even during her talk with the Karyakartas she told them that the it was time to show maturity. She has given her full support to me. But what is your personal opinion about Tejaswini missing the ticket?When her name was first finalised by the state leadership, it must be March 11, I was the first to extend my support to her and remember posting on social media that she was the most deserving candidate and a good choice from the constituency. But the party decided to field an ordinary karyakarta like me. It is a decision taken by big people and I am just a foot soldier obeying their diktat. I have always supported Tejaswini ma’am and was literally groomed by that family. I have no reason for acrimony. Statements by Karti Chidamabaram suggest that you are the Schutzstaffel of BJP, or the infamous SS of the Nazi Germany... Your tweets also suggest that your idealogical beliefs are in conflict with the “Sab Ka Saath Sab Ka Vikas” For Karti Chidambaram and others I will reply back to them in their own coin. The idealogical inclinations are not an issue for this election. The issue for the election today, is PM Modi’s promise of a new and superpower India. My only concern as on today is to ensure that Bangalore South elects the BJP with a massive margin so that we will strengthen Modi hands. Rest is immaterial. Is age an advantage or do you require time to project yourself as a leader?That the party leadership has reposed faith in me speaks for itself and the least minimum I can do is to live up to it and say I am capable enough as on today to take on these challenges. You must rise to the occasion and I will rise to it. On dynasty politics, considering you are a nephew of a sitting BJP MLA and PM Modi has gone on the offensive against the Congress on the issue of “Naamdar”...My candidature and my role and activity in politics has no connection to my uncle’s political life. I have an identity of my own and have worked very hard over years. My aspirations precedes his elections. If the party leadership thought I was a rise to another dynast, they would not have considered me at all. In Video:BJP announces 28-year-old Tejasvi Surya for Bengaluru South seatDownload The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

BJP List 2019 Maharashtra.description: AURANGABAD/KOLHAPUR: Sitting MPs Sunil Gaikwad (Latur) and Dilip Gandhi (Ahmednagar) were denied tickets for the forthcoming Lok Sabha elections in the BJP’s first national list of candidates announced on Thursday. The list included 16 names from Maharashtra. While speculations were rife that the party would not retain Gaikwad owing to his differences with some senior BJP leaders, what came as a surprise was the ticket going to Sudhakar Shrungare, a member of the Latur zilla parishad. However, Shrungare, who is in the construction business, was the popular choice of local BJP workers. Gaikwad had won the 2014 election by a majority of over 2.5 lakh votes. Considered to be close to Union minister Nitin Gadkari, he was reportedly at loggerheads with Latur district guardian minister Sambhaji Patil-Nilangekar. The nomination of Sujay Vikhe Patil, son of senior Congress leader Radhakrishna Vikhe Patil, from Ahmednagar instead of Gandhi was a foregone conclusion ever since he joined the party last week. Sujay, a neurosurgeon by profession, will be making his entry into politics with this nomination. His late grandfather, Balasaheb Vikhe Patil, was long associated with the Congress. | Full coverage of Lok Sabha elections in MaharashtraAmong other prominent leaders from Maharashtra in the first list of candidates are Union minister Nitin Gadkari from his hometown Nagpur, state BJP chief Raosaheb Danve from Jalna, Union MoS Hansraj Ahir from Chandrapur and Union MoS for defence Subash Bhamre from Dhule. Late BJP MP Gopinath Munde’s daughter, Pritam, who was elected to Parliament with a record majority after her father’s death, has been renominated from Beed. Sitting MP from Sangli Sanjay Patil has also been renominated, putting an end to speculation over any change in constituency. Patil’s candidature was opposed by a section of BJP leaders in Sangli. However, chief minister Devendra Fadnavis is understood to have called a meeting of local party leaders and resolved the differences. The party has also given tickets to Heena Gavit from Nandurbar, Raksha Khadse from Raver, Poonam Mahajan from Mumbai North Central, Kapil Patil from Bhiwandi, Sanjay Dhotre from Akola, Ramdas Tadas from Wardha, Ashok Nete from Gadchiroli and Gopal Shetty from Mumbai North.
